Executioner of the Wicked

Among the rotting horrors of the Barrow-downs, a gathering of corrupt and evil creatures holds sway over a black court. You must find and slay each of these evil abominations if there is to be any hope of wresting the grip of darkness from this once-hallowed place.
The folk of Bree-land hail your efforts to purge the barrows of the Barrow-downs of the evil within.
Defeat Barrow-spirits in the barrows
Nemesis of the Fallen

The recently unsealed barrows have been found to be inhabited by hateful Barrow-spirits. Those who fight to defeat these spirits and return them to the final rest they have escaped will be recognized by the grateful folk of Bree-land.
You have been strengthened by your efforts to purge the barrows of the Barrow-downs of the evil within.
Defeat Barrow-spirits in the barrows
Nemesis of the Fallen (Advanced)

The recently unsealed barrows have been found to be inhabited by hateful Barrow-spirits. Those who fight to defeat these spirits and return them to the final rest they have somehow escaped will be recognized by the grateful folk of Bree-land.

Brúllug is an enormous drake of exceptional cunning and cruelty. Spies suggest that he was sent recently from the wastes of Angmar to ensure the victory of the Dourhands and the overthrow of the Longbeards.
Indeed, it is believed that he may well have been sent to wrest control from the Dourhands themselves and enslave them once and for all to the yoke of Angmar, though they are too foolish and greedy to see their doom as it stoops down upon them.

Glúmir is one of the champions of the Dourhands who hold Sarnúr. While a powerful warrior, he is a witless thrall of Angmar, serving their bidding even as he believes that he fights for the glory of the Dourhands, who stand now on the verge of enslavement to the power of the Witch-king.

Latub is the most cunning and wicked of the goblins who have come to 'serve' the Dourhands as allies in their deceitful war with Thorin's kin. Like as not, it will be his dagger that is found stuck between the ribs of any who dare question the authority of Angmar among the ranks of the Dourhands.

While wolves have long been known to serve the powers of darkness in ravening packs from the hills, some few of the feline variety have been coaxed into service by playing to their considerable vanity -- Northpaw is one such.
While he has been known to snack upon the occasional unwary goblin, Northpaw is one of the most accomplished stalkers and spies in the service of the dark forces who move against Ered Luin, and few ever see aught but his shadow before they fall.

It is uncertain whom Icerender serves, if anyone. More likely this cunning beast found his way into the ruins of Sarnúr many years ago and has stalked its crumbling ways ever since, avoided by dwarves and goblins alike as his appetite threatens any who cross his path.

A brooding, reclusive creature, Gâdhûp leads his fellow trolls to act as the hammer of the Dourhands -- but their true loyalty lies with Angmar, having been branded into them over long years of pain and cruelty, and they will never bow to another master.
You have defeated Brúllug of Sarnúr

Avenger of Sarnúr

An alliance of enemies plots against Ered Luin from within the ancient ruins of Sarnúr, as the traitorous Dourhands seek to bring an array of forces to bear against their hated cousins the Longbeards. They seek to claim legitimacy by holding the seat of an ancient dwarf-city, but their presence in the company of such evils only defiles the sanctity of their ancestors.

Within the tunnels of Taradan's barrow, the webs of the Barrow-spiders create deadly traps for the unwary, for any who become trapped within are soon sucked dry, reduced to lifeless husks by the hunger of these eight-legged horrors.
Defeat Barrow-spiders in the barrow of Taradan

The evil spider Gwigon has made its lair amongst the twisting barrow of Taradan, and there her brood multiplies. They seek to ensnare any living thing foolish enough to wander in amongst the bones and dust of long-fallen princes.
In your ceaseless battle against the spiders of Taradan's barrow, you have learned to tap inner reserves of which you were previously unaware.
Defeat Barrow-spiders in the barrow of Taradan
Brood-hunter (Advanced)

The evil spider Gwigon has made her lair among the twisting barrow of Taradan, and there her brood multiplies. They seek to ensnare any living thing foolish enough to wander in among the bones and dust of long-fallen princes.
After much back-breaking toil to restore the Dead to their proper state, you feel at least that you have learned something from your efforts.
Defeat Barrow-wardens in the Barrow-downs
Grave-digger (Advanced)

The scent of grave-soil lingers ever present in the air of the Barrow-downs, offering constant reminder of how many lay buried within its twisting corridors -- though it seems now that few of them lay resting as they were meant to....

So many corpses have clawed up from their graves amongst the barrows of Haudh Iarchith, that it seems you have more need of a shovel than a sword as you strive to force them back to their eternal rest.
Defeat Barrow-wardens in the Barrow-downs

The scent of grave-soil lingers ever present in the air of the Barrow-downs, offering constant reminder of how many lay buried within its twisting corridors -- though it seems now that few of them lay resting as they were meant to....

A number of vicious and corrupted beasts reside within the ruins of Sarnúr, and they have fallen under the sway of the Dourhands and their allies.
Your will and strength has mastered these vermin nevertheless.
Defeat beasts in Sarnúr
Master of Beasts

Many wild beasts stalk the ruins of Sarnúr, but these creatures have been enslaved or twisted to the will of Angmar through the cunning devices of the goblins, who breed and cruelly torment them. Many now act as spies and guards for the Dourhands and must be destroyed, lest they be unleashed into the lands of Ered Luin to wreak mischief and havoc upon its peoples.
Your battles against the enslaved beasts within the ruins of Sarnúr have strengthened you, though they weigh heavily upon your heart.
Defeat beasts in Sarnúr
Master of Beasts (Advanced)

Many wild beasts stalk the ruins of Sarnúr, but these creatures have been enslaved or twisted to the will of Angmar through the cunning devices of the goblins, who breed and cruelly torment them. Many now act as spies and guards for the Dourhands and must be destroyed, lest they be unleashed into the lands of Ered Luin to wreak mischief and havoc upon its peoples.
The people of Ered Luin owe much to your battles against the Dourhands and their dark allies, for every one that falls before you staves off the time when they may begin their assault in earnest.
Defeat Dourhands in Sarnúr
Betrayer's Bane

The dwarf-ruins of Sarnúr have been discovered and occupied by the Dourhands, who plan to use them as a base from which to strike at the Longbeards -- worse yet, they have allied themselves with evil and corrupted creatures who owe their true allegiance to the powers of Angmar. You must take your battle against the Dourhands onto the crumbling streets of Sarnúr before they build their strength and are bolstered further by forces sent from Angmar.
You have been strengthened by your seemingly endless battle against the Dourhands of Sarnúr.
Defeat Dourhands in Sarnúr
Betrayer's Bane (Advanced)

The dwarf-ruins of Sarnúr have been discovered and occupied by the Dourhands, who plan to use them as a base from which to strike at the Longbeards -- worse yet, they have allied themselves with evil and corrupted creatures who owe their true allegiance to the powers of Angmar. You must take your battle against the Dourhands onto the crumbling streets of Sarnúr before they build their strength and are bolstered further by forces sent from Angmar.

Your battles against the Snow-trolls of Sarnúr have earned you the praise of the folk of Ered Luin -- but as Angmar continues to pour forces into all the realms of Eriador, you find you must redouble your efforts to stem the tide.
Defeat Snow-trolls in Sarnúr

It seems that the trolls inhabiting Sarnúr are of a particularly dim-witted -- if brutal -- strain. With hearts of hard-edged ice, they will destroy anything that stands in their way unless you can stop them.
Only in the constant temper of your battle against the trolls of Sarnúr could you have learned such difficult lessons as these.
Defeat Snow-trolls in Sarnúr
Troll-kicker (Advanced)

Eat Barrow-brie
The Unwise
You ate the cheese!

Cirith Daur was once one of the major passes that travellers used to enter the High Pass. Even at the best of times, it is torn by winds and storms and is treacherous to pass through. It often becomes completely impassable during the late seasons, blocking all access between communities on the eastern and western sides of the Misty Mountains.

This small cave in the rocks of the High Pass offers apparent shelter for travellers in times of storm, but it was long ago discovered to be a concealed entrance into the burrows of Goblin-town below, from which goblins would emerge in the dark of night to kidnap those foolish enough to make camp here.
These days the crack sees little use as few even attempt the crossing any more, and the goblins more frequently emerge through the larger gate down below as they make ominous preparations for war.

Dómstoll -- more often called the Giant's Throne in Westron -- is a great seat of massive stones that sits above the abandoned ruins of Starkhath and offers a domineering view of the surrounding region when it is not obscured by driving snow and mist.
Most of the giants left this place long ago, but rumours say that one, at least, still remains to watch over this lonely domain.

The Erforgh Cleft is a massive jumble of rocks and frozen streams left behind by some great mass of ice in ages past. Now it offers some semblance of shelter from the most brutal mountain winds to a nomadic tribe of Gauredain who have made their home here.
Whether the Gauredain came here of their own accord or were directed here by the Enemy is uncertain, but their presence is troubling nonetheless.

This complex of caves called the Writhenbores seems to be formed by a great mass of boulders, larger than even the giants could hope to lift. How they came to be this way is a mystery -- perhaps by the fall of an entire peak upon the mountainside below or some equally cataclysmic event.
The caves are oddly warmer than the wind-stripped slopes outside, possibly heated by a warm spring welling up from deep below the mountain. However, any traveller hoping to take shelter within would be strongly advised to look elsewhere, for this same warmth has drawn a large and deadly brood of worms into these caves, and to carelessly wander within is certain death.

A group of travellers who passed this way many years ago described a place where giants capriciously tossed boulders across the pass for sport and amusement.
The giants appear to be gone now -- some say they were driven away when a new Great Goblin took the throne of Goblin-town and relations between the two races became intolerable. In time, tired of being tormented by their diminutive foes, the giants left this place and moved towards Iorbar to the south-west.
Only the massive stone slabs that they once used as shelter remain, echoing with the howls of the Wargs who now prowl among them.

Founded before the city of Helegrod, Hrimbarg was once called 'The Crown of the Misty Mountains' by the dwarves who lived there, and they marked it as the highest dwelling of their people in all the world at that time.
Alas, it fell neither to goblins nor giants nor dragons or other wickedness -- but tales say it fell to a great storm that drove down upon the High Pass and did not relent for five long years, choking the passes with vast mountains of ice, even burying Hrimbarg itself beneath a deep, featureless blanket of snow.
When at last the storm relented and their fellows from Moria came north to relieve their brothers at Hrimbarg, not one dwarf was found alive, all having frozen or starved during the long years of isolation. It was decided thereafter that Hrimbarg should not be resettled, and it has stood empty for years beyond reckoning.

Newly built since the ascension of the new Great Goblin of Goblin-town, the camp of Akûltot is set among rock ledges and spires that overlook the approach to the main gates of Goblin-town. Historically, the goblins of the Misty Mountains have eschewed the construction of camps in the inhospitable drifts and glaring light of the High Pass, and it is unsettling that they should choose to do so now.
The only likely explanation is that they are preparing to extend their grasp beyond the mountains in some fashion, which is surely ill news to those who live in the hills and forests below.
You have discovered Cirith Daur
You have discovered the Black Crack
You have discovered Dómstoll
You have discovered Erforgh Cleft
You have discovered the Writhenbores
You have discovered Starkhath
You have discovered Hrimbarg
You have discovered Akûltot
The Forbidding Heights

While most folks sensibly stay home and tend to fields and shops, some hardy adventurers are drawn to the most inhospitable and difficult places in Middle-earth. Few such places pose so great a challenge as the stretch of the Misty Mountains surrounding the region of the High Pass, which is fraught with hazards -- both natural and otherwise -- to test the most rugged individuals.
EXPLORE STUFF

The War Steading serves as a large barracks for Goblin-town, where their soldiers and skirmishers gather and prepare for raids upon the villages to either side of the Mountains. Mostly, they descend through the passages to the east to fall upon the smaller and more weakly defended settlements of Men which border the Mirkwood, but on occasion, when their strength grows, they have been known to raid Elf-settlements on the edges of Rivendell's domain -- though these over-bold assaults generally turn out badly for the goblins, and few return.

The Thundergrot is aptly named for the enormous booming sounds that echo through the surrounding caves and passages. This thunder is produced by massive drums carried by the Cave-trolls bred and enslaved by the goblins and employed when they raid larger settlements under cover of night.

The stench and horror of the Slave Pens of Goblin-town are the subject of dark rumour among travellers who must brave the High Pass, for it is well-known that the goblins delight in taking such folk captive and dragging them down into the depths of the Mountains where they are pressed into cruel labour in the darkness, and few ever again see the light of day.

Gollum's Cave is a dark, silent lake nestled down near the roots of the Misty Mountains, and it is said that even the goblins fear it greatly and rarely come here.
The famed hobbit-burglar Bilbo Baggins stumbled into this cave long ago, and there met the wretched creature Gollum. It is said he won his freedom through a Riddle-game, but there is rumour that he did not play fairly.

The throne room of Goblin-town, the Den of the Great Goblin, is not a place where most travellers wish to find themselves. Possessed of an odd and unfair sense of justice, the goblins usually bring their captives before the Great Goblin to face his judgement rather than simply imprisoning or killing them. His judgement for presumptive crimes usually involves spying or tresspassing upon the goblin's domain.
Unfortunately for the hapless captives, the outcome of these encounters is fore-ordained, and the punishment for such infractions is always unpleasant -- and ultimately fatal.

This sweltering cave houses the forges of Goblin-town, where cruel implements of war and torture are fashioned by over-clever smiths whose knowledge descends from ages ago when the Dark Lord taught them the arts of metalsmithy.

The true origin of the ruins that can be found scattered in these caverns is unknown. It is clear that once the dwarves delved here and built their tunnels and mines, but this was lost and abandoned to the goblins so long ago that even among Durin's Folk there are few who remember the names of those who built it or how their story came to an end.
You have discovered the War Steadings
You have discovered Thundergrot
You have discovered the Slave Pens
You have discovered Gollum's Cave
You have discovered the Great Goblin's Den
You have discovered the Deep-fires
You have discovered Eglanúr

Few know the full extent of the depths of Goblin-town, and those who have experienced them most likely died therin as slaves to cruel goblin-overseers. The goblins themselves may not know all the ways, for the deepest passages extend far into the heart of the Misty Mountains where dark and unseen terrors lie, and the goblins will not brave these passages unless driven or enraged.
EXPLORE STUFF

Though worms can be found scattered in other areas of the Trollshaws, the breed here has grown particularly deadly and numerous. Indeed, the aggressive hunting instincts of these vicious beasts do a great deal to dissuade those few explorers and settlers who might otherwise take up their livelihoods in the Wilds of Tal Bruinen.

The ruin of Echad Candelleth is believed by scholars to have once been a centre of art and learning in the ancient kingdom of Rhudaur, before it fell beneath the corrupt sway of Angmar and was destroyed in wars with its neighbours after which even its original name was lost.
Now it simply acts as a makeshift camp for those hardy souls brave enough to explore the surrounding wilds.

Though it is a wonder to behold, travellers who allow themselves to be lulled by the natural beauty of Eryn Singor rarely emerge from its treacherous ravines.
A host of deadly Wood-trolls have taken up residence within, and delight in descending upon unwary hunters and explorers and tearing them limb from limb.

While civilized men long ago quit these hills, a tribe of wild men have recently taken up residence here, seemingly at home amongst the dangerous beasts and natural hazards of the region.
Alas, they are of a savage disposition and display an obvious hatred of those who intrude upon their territory from more civilized lands.

It is said that there is a nesting area for the numerous worms who infest Tal Bruinen, and it would seem that you have stumbled upon it here at Torech Ullug.
Take care! The mothers of nesting worms are known for their particulary vicious disposition, as well as a ravenous appetite for fresh meat to feed to their young.

What are these strange ruins? They seem to be of ancient Cardolan origins, but the Elves of Rivendell seem hesitant to speak of them at all. Some strange mystery surrounds them, and it may be that the only answers can be found within...
You have discovered Cirith Ulunn
You have discovered Echad Candelleth
You have discovered Eryn Singor
You have discovered Echad Gauradan
You have discovered Torech Ullug
You have discovered Delossad
The Wilds of Tâl Bruinen

The southern Trollshaws are dominated by the Wilds of Tâl Bruinen. Few even amongst the Elves live here now, and the forested hills have become heavily overgrown and inhabited mostly by wild beasts that pose a constant danger to travellers and the few who try to eke out an existence in these undisciplined lands.
Explore the wild extents of the southern Trollshaws.

A brass button stained with something... blood perhaps?
In any case, it certainly is not a goblin-relic -- it looks more like something you would find on a hobbit's waistcoat....
This odd little brass button is heavily tarnished and worse for wear - but it seems that at some point it would have set well upon a rather fine coat or jacket. How did goblins get this?
This brass button is old and worse for wear, but it looks like some curious goblin has polished it recently. He must have carried it as a keepsake of some sort.
How odd -- a brass waistcoat button in the depths of Goblin-town? The face of the button appears to have been heavily scratched, perhaps against a rock face at some point in the distant past.

This bit of brass finery seems out of place in the dark warrens of Goblin-town. It also seems to have been bent, perhaps in whatever incident separated it from the waistcoat it once must have secured.

This brass button looks surprisingly well-kept, and you can still faintly see the etched design on it that marks it as being of Shire manufacture -- but what hobbit in his right mind would venture into the depths of Goblin-town wearing a waistcoat!?
Interesting -- this appears to be a cufflink that might have once been in fashion among the Hobbits of the Shire, but the post has snapped, and it is of little value now.

This cufflink looks like it might have once been a rather fine piece of jewellery -- likely of hobbit-make -- but it appears to have been badly marred and blackened when some clumsy goblin dropped it into a fire pit some time ago.

How strange... scattered throughout the warrens of Goblin-town seem to be a set of old, well-worn brass buttons, as if lost from a Hobbit's waistcoat. How in the world did such things come to be in these dark and twisted tunnels?
Find Bilbo's lost buttons

Crebain have become common in recent years, as the foul birds from the South have infested many lands in the North. Rumours that some of these ill-tempered birds may have been trained to serve the forces of Mordor do little to increase your appreciation of them.

The tradition of music in Middle-earth goes back to the very first days of the Elves, if the tales of the First-born are to be believed. Even today, those who hand down the tradition and knowledge of music are held in high esteem by all the Free Peoples.
Teach the art of music to your fellows
Mentor of Song
You must train pupils in the art of music and song, ensuring that the most ancient traditions of Middle-earth may continue unbroken.
This is your objective description.

Though few musicians understand the arts of song as a Minstrel can, the breadth of the art is increased greatly when common folk are encouraged to participate. Great choruses and ensembles can produce beauty and complexity well beyond the reach of any individual performer, no matter how gifted.
Teach the art of music to your fellows

Abb was a great leader and healer of the Hillmen of Rhudaur. He was one of the last Chieftains taken into the service of the Enemy.
Kolmak was the second of the Hillman-chieftains who took service with the Enemy and often used fell poisons on his blade.
Ánraig was the fiercest of those that were converted to the Enemy's evil cause and was often at the head of the armies brought against the people of Arthedain.
Guinokh was longest in the service of the Enemy and had the most malice and subtlety of those that wielded a blade under the Witch-king against Cardolan.
Innis was one of the lesser Chieftains converted by the enemy and rather wielded the bow than the sword.
Kevoka was one of the Hillmen-chieftains tricked into service of the Enemy.
Few men lived to tell tales of Mánas brutality, for he would often put his captives to a cruel death.

Forochel is dotted with many small hunting-camps, including Hylje-leiri, the Camp of the Seal.
Karhu-leiri, the Camp of the Bear, is one of many Lossoth hunting-camps spread across Forochel.
Pynti-leiri, the Camp of the Hunt, is one of the more popular hunting-camps of the Lossoth.
Norsu-leiri, the Camp of the Mammoth, was established by the Lossoth as a place from which to hunt the native mammoths.
You have discovered Hylje-leiri!
You have discovered Karhu-leiri!

The Battle for Forochel
Discover each of the key battlegrounds for control of the Ice Bay of Forochel.
NOT USED

In an age when dwarves mined the crags and bluffs of Forochel, they built many fortresses. Kibilzahar is one such place, though it has been long abandoned. Rumour has it that fell spirits now dwell here, but rumours run wild among old ruins....

The Ironspan was built by the dwarves long ago, as they sought precious metals and gems in the mountains of Forochel and Angmar. When the dwarves abandoned their endeavours, the Witch-realm of Angmar wrested control of the great gates.
Zigilgund is an ancient dwarf-site to which the Longbeards have only recently returned.
The Lonesome Stones are a weary and ruined reminder of ancient days when dwarves mined the crags of Forochel.
The Icereave Mines long stood unused, but now the Dourhands seek to use them for their own benefit.
You have discovered Kibilzahar!
You have discovered the Ironspan!
You have discovered Zigilgund!
You have discovered the Lonesome Stones!
You have discovered the Icereave Mines!
Ancient Stones of Forochel
While the Lossoth of Forochel are not great builders, the dwarves long ago had many mines and encampments in the North.
NOT USED
Your efforts to aid the Lossoth and confound the plans of Angmar have gone some way towards improving your reputation with the hardy inhabitants of Forochel.
Complete quests in Forochel
Forochel Expeditionary

The Lossoth of Forochel are engaged in a constant struggle against their enemies the Gauredain, against the savage northern wild-life, and against the elements themselves.
While one might expect them to receive help gratefully, this constant hardship has also bred a strong independence among their people -- it will take a great deal of effort to win them over to the cause of the Free Peoples of Eriador.
Complete Quests in Forochel.

Tales say that long ago the last king of the North fled into Forochel ahead of the victorious armies of Angmar, and the Elf-ship which came to rescue him was crushed by the grinding ice of the bay and sank with all aboard. And so ended the line of Kings in the North.
Even though the power of Angmar was soon overthrown by a great force sent by Gondor, the North Kingdom of Arnor was never rebuilt and the land lay fallow and sparsely settled by Men for many long years thereafter.
Complete quests in Forochel
Forochel Survivor

The greatest danger in Forochel is the harsh environment itself. The bitter winds and ice have torn the life from more hardy folk than the claws of the kalpa-kita or spears of the Gauredain -- though those dangers come a close second.
Complete Forochel Expeditionary.
Complete 20 Forochel Quests.

Your efforts here in a land of endless winter have endeared you to many of the Lossoth who live in the region. Between your efforts and those of the others who have fought on behalf of these folk, perhaps the Angmarim and their allies can be hindered in their evil designs.
Complete quests in Forochel
Forochel Pioneer
The brutal wilderness of Forochel would keep all but the hardiest at bay, but for those with the spirit to endure and thrive in its environment, its call may prove irresistable at the last.
Complete Forochel Survivor.
Complete Forochel Quests

It seems that the Angmarim have sent little more than a small expeditionary force into Forochel as yet. Perhaps they are content to focus on the greater battles in the North Downs? Or maybe there is some limit to the force they can yet marshal against the North. In either case, you are doing your best to whittle those forces down.
Defeat Angmarim in Forochel

So it seems that the shadowy fingers of Angmar have stretched even into desolate Forochel, sewing the seeds of conflict here as in all places they touch.
Here at least, it seems that their preparations are less ready than elsewhere, or perhaps they find little of value, for they rely mostly on their less trustworthy allies -- the Dourhands and the savage Gauredain -- rather than their well-ordered hordes of Orcs and evil Men.

Your constant attacks against the Angmarim in Forochel have doubtlessly drawn the ire of their commanders, for the line of supply with Angmar lies though difficult and harsh mountain passes. You have made their minor expedition into Forochel a far more costly affair than they had certainly bargained for.
Defeat Angmarim in Forochel
Angmarim-slayer (Advanced)

It seems that the Angmarim may at best be searching for something, or perhaps simply meddling in the conflicts between the Lossoth and the Gauredain. A full-strength invasion does not seem to be their purpose in Forochel -- at least, not yet.

The Dourhands have brought a strong force into the ancient mines here, but for all the battles you have faced them in, it is hard to say if they are actually getting any mining done here. They seem fonder of braggart tales and meaningless battles than they are of the honest work that most dwarves pursue.
Defeat Dourhands in Forochel

Old dwarf-ruins litter the landscape of Forochel. Being the hardiest of the Free Peoples, the dwarves claim that they were the first to settle here long ago, in hopes of finding riches beneath the frozen earth -- but most of these settlements were abandoned long ago.
Hoping to strengthen their claims as legitimate heirs of the ancient Dwarf-lords, the Dourhands seek to re-build these settlements with the aid of their Angmarim allies, but this has brought their cousins the Longbeards north as well, seeking to dispute their claims, no matter the worth (or lack thereof) of the mines here.

It is often disheartening to do battle with so many who should be called friends and allies, but the Dourhands chose their path and their allies themselves, and it seems that it is not for you to convince them of their folly, save in heated conflict.
Defeat Dourhands in Forochel
Dourhand-slayer (Advanced)

The attempts by the Dourhands to claim a legitimate descent from the Dwarf-lords of old seems futile at this point, as their dark alliance with Angmar becomes more common knowledge among the dwarves of Middle-earth -- but if anything, this turn of events has only made them more dangerous and desperate, as they now fight for the very survival of their misguided house.

More so than the groups you have encountered elsewhere, the Gauredain of Forochel do battle with a deadly strength and confidence given perhaps by familiarity with the terrain of their homeland. These fights are bitter and brutal affairs with little room for finesse or quarter, which the Gauredain consider forms of base cowardice.
Defeat Gauredain in Forochel

At last you have come upon the homeland of the Gauredain -- and in seeing it, it becomes clear how they came to be such powerful brutes, shaped by the vicious elements and hardships of Forochel, it is hard to imagine them otherwise -- and yet the Lossoth still maintain the trappings of civilization under the same hardships. Have the Gauredain chosen their path in this fashion, or is their brutal path some long-ago contrivance of the Enemy?

The attacks of the Gauredain have become more frequent than ever -- their anger growing with the intrusion of Southerners such as yourself, and perhaps something else. It seems ever more likely that the hand of Angmar is behind their recent aggression.
Defeat Gauredain in Forochel
Gauradan-slayer (Advanced)

It seems odd indeed that two people such as the Gauredain and the Lossoth should do battle to claim such a forbidding and difficult land as Forochel, and yet they strive endlessly over it. It seems that home is the place you know, and wherever that might be, Men, dwarves, hobbits, Elves, Orcs -- and whatever else -- will fight to defend it.
Your battles with the grims have revealed little of their true nature, save for their unrelenting hatred for creatures of warmth and light.
Defeat grims in Forochel

The Gauredain believe that the grims are the wandering souls of those among their people who were cast out for their cowardice, damned to eternally wander the frozen snow-fields after they froze to death in the ice. Those few among the wise who know of these creatures, however, suspect that they are more likely fell spirits left wandering the northern wastes long after the fall of their ancient Dark Lord.

You have begun to think that the Gauredain are indeed mistaken in their beliefs.
The windy howls of the grim hint only at malice and glee as they strive to strip the flesh of living things with stinging needles of ice.
Defeat grims in Forochel
Grim-slayer (Advanced)

If there is the slightest trace of a once-living spirit within the grim, it would seem that it is not enough to show any sign of compassion or mercy. At the slightest sign of warmth or life they strike, seemingly intent on snuffing it out in a howling assault of hail and hatred.

What the sabre-tooth cat lacks in terms of packs and numbers to the Warg, it more than makes up for in sheer power and ferocity. These deadly hunters seem to relish stalking their prey through the long, cold winter nights, and though you have fought them many times before, you still get the nagging feeling that one of them is due to catch you off-guard some time soon....
Defeat sabre-tooths in Forochel
Sabre-tooth Slayer

These savage cats are predators of a particularly vicious and undiscerning nature. The Lossoth make sure to respect their territory during the hunt, lest they become a meal for these deadly creatures. Likewise what livestock they raise is under constant threat by these voracious beasts.

At one point during your frequent sabre-tooth hunts, you considered for a time whether or not their cubs could be domesticated and raised as pets or hunting animals of a sort -- but you came back to your senses when you remembered how fond you were of your fingers and hands.
Defeat sabre-tooth in Forochel
Sabre-tooth Slayer (Advanced)

The sabre-tooth cats are a deadly and frequent hazard of the forests of Forochel. Only the bravest hunters amongst the Lossoth will dare to hunt in the vicinity of a Sabertooth den, and even they occasionally fail to return.

The worms of Forochel are detestable enemies. Sometimes it seems to you while you are out hunting that you shall never feel the warmth of a fire or of the summer sun again -- such is the cold that emanates from their horrid claws and frozen breath.
Defeat worms in Forochel

The Worms of Forochel have adapted to the eternally cold environment, growing a coat of strangely-furred scales to ward off the cold, while their claws and teeth carry a strange cold of their own, often causing those who suffer wounds from them to succumb to a deadly chill.

As it turns out, the cold up in Forochel is not that bad once you get used to it, or so the Lossoth say -- unfortunately, you are pretty sure you will never get used to it no matter how many of these accursed worms you manage to kill. It certainly does not seem to bring much cheer to this warmth-forsaken land in any case.
Defeat worms in Forochel
Worm-slayer (Advanced)

It is uncertain whether these worms are native to Forochel or whether they have come down from the Northern Wasteland during the winter when the Ice Bay is frozen solid enough to travel across. Of course, it no longer matters from whence they came, for they are here now and a threat to all who live in Forochel.

The destruction of Eregion by Sauron in the Second Age scattered its vast knowledge of Ring-craft far and wide. The forces of Angmar have now taken an interest in gathering this lore for the purpose of reforging the ring Narchuil.
By aiding in the recovery of this lore, you both hinder the efforts of Angmar and further Elrond's research in a way to stop Amarthiel.
You have aided in the search for the lost Ring-lore of Eregion.

From within a cleft nestling in the crags of Urugarth, Dushkal commands a host of trolls.
For years, the drake-matron has called the southern crags of Urugarth her home despite efforts to drive her from her roost.

Before the gates to Asht-Shâpol lies Lagmas' Court. From here, the Uruk-captain Lagmas and his second-in-command Morthang rally and muster the forces of Urugarth as they prepare to march upon Eriador.
Winding their way down from the sewers of Carn Dûm, the viscous Fell-waters spill into Urugarth, poisoning the air and land around them.
The Warg-pack of Urugarth calls this valley home. Led by the goblin-keeper Athpukh and the Warg Lâmkarn, these Wargs are ready to hunt the hills of Angmar at a moment's notice.
Asht-Shâpol is the seat of power in Urugarth. Within the remains of this castle resides the Uruk-captain Lagmâs and his flock of deadly crebain.

This district of Carn Dûm, now called Urugarth, fell to ill-repair due to the foul waters pouring from the sewers of the seat of Angmar. Urugarth was given to the Orcs of Angmar and set as a staging point from which its terrible army could march.

Amid the foul waters of Carn Dûm lies the slave-pens of the Trév Duvárdain. It is here that those who have challenged the might of the Steward of Angmar are pressed into his service against their will.
The Gorthorog-captain Barashal commands his minions from this post within the eastern crags on the outskirts of Carn Dûm.
The water you found in this place was a putrescent green, contaminated with the vile poisons of Carn Dûm.

While Carn Dûm has many enemies, there are those that call it ally as well. Among them are the Hillmen of the Trév Duvárdain. This alliance has granted the Trév Duvárdain a district of their own within the city.
It is from the Castle of Carn Dûm that the Witch-king of Angmar oversaw his domain, and it is from here that Mordirith, the Steward of Angmar, does the same.

The Seat of the Witch-king is a well-appointed room adorned with vicious looking statues and ornaments. It was here that the Ranger Golodir confronted Moridirth in battle and forced retreat upon the Steward of Angmar.
Looking south over the sprawl of Carn Dûm, this balcony affords the perfect location to survey the whole of the city.

Defend Annúminas from the forces of Angmar

Defend Annúminas from the forces of Angmar
Warden of Annúminas
Your efforts within Annúminas have not gone unnoticed by the Rangers. Because of your unceasing aid in the defence of the City of the Kings, they have bestowed upon you the title of Warden.
You have defeated many of the Dead in the defence of Annúminas.
Defeat the Dead within Annúminas
Spirits Aiding Angmar (Advanced)
Defeat the Dead within Annúminas.
This is one of the various plaques found in Annúminas denoting a place of import.

Defeat Boars in Eriador
Defeat Boars in Eriador
For too long, Boar-kind has plagued the land. In your efforts, you have shown a desire to drive them from Middle-earth.
Cowards fear your very name. Why not call them all /chicken and bring them home to roost.
Defeat any combination of twenty players within the Ettenmoors.
Calling them Home to Roost
Defeat twenty players across the Ettenmoors.
There is something in the air tonight. Perhaps you should /sniff the air to find out what it is.
Defeat any combination of thirty players within the Ettenmoors.
Something in the Air
Defeat thirty foes in the Ettenmoors.
The very sight of you drives fear into the heart of your enemies. You may now /taunt them mercilessly!
Defeat any combination of ten players within the Ettenmoors.
Taunting the Foe
Defeat ten players across the Ettenmoors.

A Champion is acutely aware of his surrounding throughout battle. This sesitivity and understanding can allow them to more readily access their skills when their understanding and control has reached a greater level.
Strike with Battle Acuity or Enhanced Battle Acuity
Battle Acumen
Master your understanding of battle and the space in which it takes place so that you can end battles more swiftly in the future.
Many of the nations of Middle-earth employ distinctive styles of horns. While some are imbued with a greater power than another, the power and will of the wielder can make up for much.
Strike with Horn of Gondor
Mighty Blast
You must master your horn-blowing technique to use the horns of the South Kingdom.

'If you have gone to the trouble of getting past enough hide, metal, or mail to make them bleed, you might find it worth your while to cut a strap or two on your way out. I usually do.' -- Brethilthor, Stone-troll Slayer
Strike with Cleave or Rend
Improved Rend
Practice your attacks which cause bleeding in your foes.
In a sword-fight, it is usually a safe bet that the man without a blade is in a bad way. You, however, have learned how to hedge that bet better than most.
Strike with Hedge or Improved Hedge
Tight Grip
Practice your weapon-recovering strike; it could save your life...or a friend's.

Many a champion improves his running strength barrelling into battles or to the aid of an ally. On occassion, a champion finds all the training useful at the other end of a fight -- but more often its to find the next foe before the last has come to rest on the ground.
Use Sprint
Build your sprinting stamina with focused training.
The veteran eye can sometimes see when a foe's strength starts to flag even before the enemy himself knows it.
Strike with Merciful Strike
Bountiful Mercy
Learn to identify the turning point in a foe's strength and strike.

'Why is it that the last thing anyone expects from me is a little self-control? Do you think anyone lasts particularly long swinging a pair of blades about your body without a little control?' -- Grímr, Champion of the Blue Mountains
Use Controlled Burn
Controlled Fury
Master self-control, and many techniques will be possible that were not before.
It is true that sometimes success in battle may take a toll on the conscience of the victor. Not all enemies begin as such and even the champion, confident in his cause, may grieve for the fallen.
Use Second Wind
Vigour of Champions
Use the defeat of your foe to fuel your attack against the next.
There is greater strength for the courageous than even that which they give to others. It can lead to greater independence, but may also make imparting direct commands impractical.
Use the Muster Courage skill
Strength from Within
Master drawing greater strength from the courage you share with your fellows.

The army on the field is one arm as much as it is a thousand. The arm that matters most in the moment is the one holding the blade best positioned to strike. Inspire your brother to deliver the blow, and you all will have swung the tide to victory.
Use the To Arms skill
Tactical Prowess
Master the call to arms and the empowerment of your shield-brother.

The tide of battle is at your command, and it may ebb only if you give it leave to. The commander must yield the advantage, but strike with it and you will strike with ever greater strength and vigour.
Strike with Devastating Blow or Pressing Attack
Press the advantage against your foe and strike when the time is right.
Even when the need is great or desperate, if the commander upon the field is composed, a personal sacrifice may yet yield a greater gift of inspiration and hope.
Use the Time of Need skill
You must learn to make the most of personal sacrifice to be of the greatest aid to your fellows and your cause.
The blood of Westernesse carries strength to this day, no matter how distant the days of the kings of old may seem.
Strike with Blade of Elendil
Adherent of Elendil
Invoke the name of Elendil, the Elf-friend and king of old, and let his example guide your blade.
Action is the best spark to kindle fire in your shield-brother's heart.
Use the Inspire skill
Deeds before Words
Be an example to your shield-brother, and you will find your inspiration greater still.

It is not possible for each kind word or bold proclamation to have the same effect. The hearts of your companions will receive them each time anew. You have learned how to make the markedly inspiring even more so.
Use Words of Courage or Rallying Cry
Relentless Optimism
Study how encouraging words may sometimes yield very great changes in the hearts of your fellows.
You understand well the role of the archer on the battlefield and the need for precision. Under your training and guidance, your ally has achieved new levels of excellence.
Improve your Banners of War, Hope, and Victory
Call forth your archer
Great emblems have inspired heroic efforts when it was most needed. To grant your allies that strength, the symbols of your leadership must be improved.
Precise Ally
You must field your archer to practice his art in order to cultivate greater skill and precision.
The stalwart are those who stand strong long after lesser men have abandoned hope.
Use Healing Skills
Enduring Morale
Increase your vigour and find greater well-springs of spirit within yourself.
'Let us join the tale that never ends. It goes on and on, my friends. And so shall we.' -- Burt Nine-tales, Minstrel Tale-weaver
Recite any tale
Flow of Harmony
Train to perform your heroic tales with less effort but equal effect.
You have refined your ability to attack with Herald's Strike.
There is piece of victory in every skilful swing of a sword. Draw heart from the strike, let it herald your ultimate triumph.
Complete Herald's Hammer
Use Herald's Strike
Improved Herald's Strike
Be a herald of your opponent's defeat.
Those who are composed with the resolve to face their greatest fears shall conquer them.
Use Anthem of Composure
Lyrics of Bravery
Become a master of your own will, and you will not so easily fall under the sway of others.
The clash of clamour and battle shall be intensified by your songs, sending your foes down to swift defeat.
Use Melody of Battle, Echoes of Battle or Timeless Echoes of Battle
Improved Echoes of Battle
Let the calls of battle echo from the hills and mountains in a great clamour.
'Do not give in to despair, friend. Trust in me as I trust in you, and we shall overcome even this.' -- Éadoin, Dawn-singer
Use any version of Raise the Spirit
Improved Raise the Spirit
Master the words that may raise the spirits of those who stand upon the edge of despair.
Sometimes, a soothing melody cannot come swiftly enough.
Use Song of Soothing
Improved Song of Soothing
Train yourself to diminish your appearance in the eyes of your foe.
'Breath is the life we draw in and draw upon. So long as you draw breath, you have the power to act...and to save.' -- James Grant, Healer of Ills
Use your healing songs
Power of Song
Cultivate the endurance to last through any conflict.

Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the essence of frost in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which may lower the temperature of the air about your enemies still lower.
Strike with Frost-lore
The Study of Frost-lore
Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.
One must take care when employing the sign of command. The imposition of one's will upon another can leave a lasting mark upon both.
Strike with Sign of Power: Command
Improved Sign of Power: Command
You have heard that there may be a more complete form of the sign you uncovered previously.
'Handling this substance can be, well, a sticky problem. Fortunately, I have perfected a mixture that surmounts the problem. The solution? Now, that would be telling....' -- Vistan, Master of Robes
Strike with Sticky Tar
The Secret of Tar
Refine the quality of your sticky mixtures to make them easier to prepare.

Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the essence of fire in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which may raise the temperature of the air about your enemies still higher.
Strike with Fire-lore
The Study of Fire-lore
Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.
Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of wind in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which brings stronger gusts to hamper your foe's movements even more.
Strike with Gust of Wind
The Study of Wind-lore
Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

'I believe that the path to knowledge is a road with no end. I suppose, therefore, that I will probably never get there. That is why I take frequent stops to read, have a bite to eat, lend a hand here or there, that sort of thing. Just because I take my time about it does not mean I have not gotten anywhere. There are secret things that I could show you, but...well, you would probably not enjoy the lesson.' -- Gregori, Wanderer from the Forest
Strike with Sign of Battle: Wizard's Fire
Improved Sign of Battle
Continue your study of ancient signs and the power they represent.

Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the sudden fury of storms in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which makes the sudden echoes of the storm even more dangerous to your enemies than before.
Strike with Storm-lore
Improved Storm-lore
Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.
You've mastered your Inner Flame, able to spread the benefits to nearby allies.
Use Inner Flame
Improved Inner Flame
Channeling your Inner Flame takes great effort and concentration, but the reward can be quite enlightening.
Even while on an aggressive footing, it is possible to achieve an effect similar to some shield-techniques.
Strike with Force Opening
Blocking Force
Practice opening your opponent's guard and learn how to gain further advantage from it.
'Without balance, movement is hampered; without movement, speed is hindered; without speed, the fight is against you. Remember this and apply it to your foe.' -- Tirnedhruith, Guardian Trainer
Strike with Stagger
Hit Where It Hurts
A well-placed strike can throw your opponent off-balance.
Protecting another sometimes means removing threats from the field in the most expedient manner possible.
Use Overpower
Raw Power
Practice assuming an aggressive stance and learn how to make it stronger still.
The guardian knows patience and possesses great reserves of endurance. You know how to whittle away at the composure and control of your foes until they undo themselves.
Strike with Fray the Edge
Final Straw
Practice harrying your foes, encouraging them to expose their vulnerabilities.
The true protector's armaments must needs include the right challenge, insult, or battle-cry to engage and enrage any foe he might face.
Strike with Challenge
Litany of Challenge
Master the goading of your foes...train to draw and hold their ire ever longer.
A quick boot, swiftly applied, can disrupt many an enemy's plans -- and it is best that the plans of the enemy do not come to fruition.
Strike with Stamp
Quick of Foot
Practise your stamp to interrupt your foes, for using the skill repeatedly will help you to perform it with greater ease in the future.
You have learned that your enemies' greatest weakness can be their pride. You have mastered the art of turning their rage and ignorance against them.
Strike with Shield-taunt
Shield of Fire
Taunt your foes without relent, for you know they would not spare you or your allies the blade.

'Nowadays, when someone asks for credit, I just give them \qThe Look'\q...you know? Sure, I learned it on the field, but it still comes in handy at the shop.' -- Patrick Pot-patcher, Guardian, retired
Strike with Bash
Threatening Presence
Cultivate a threatening demeanor and practice the imposing art of putting your shield into your enemy's face.
When facing off against the gambling Burglar, the odds are that their enemies find cruel chance at the point of a blade.
Achieve a critical hit with any skill unlocked by a critical hit
Cruel Odds
To better twist chance in your favour, you must first master the art of piling victory on top of success.
You have learned that the momentum of success may sometimes lead forwards and sometimes backwards. When you have the edge, taking a gamble is not such a gamble as it might have been before.
Use the Escape Clause skill
Even the Odds
Make the most of successful coordination with your allies, be it to strike fast or ready an escape.

Mastering the art of the retort may be thought of in much the same way as perfecting a skilled sword-stroke. Just as a strike may be taught from a particular pose but executed from many, you have mastered this brand of wit so it may be levied at any time.
Strike with Clever Retort
Honed Wit
With practice, the right comeback may no longer require a mind set only to mischief.
\qWhat stings more than a harsh word? A harsh word and a sharp blade.\q -- Dexter Deep-pockets, Burglar, retired
Strike with Provoke
Sharp Wit, Sharp Blade
You must master the combination of a cutting remark and a marking cut.
Precision and patience yield perfection and, for your foe, new depths of pain.
Strike with Well-placed Strike
Spatial Sense
No matter how well-placed the strike, there is always room for improvement.
Now your foes will know -- however briefly -- that location truly is everything, and that this particular location is somewhere behind their back.
Use the Location is Everything skill
Strategic Planning
If you can internalize the age old maxim, you may find the right location easier to arrive at and more effective than before.
The best riddle is one whose answer is obvious the moment after it is revealed. The strongest puzzles are the ones tempered through trial and proven with practice.
Target must resist your Riddle or Confound skills
Complicated Terms
You have picked up a few new conundrums in your travels, but you will not be able to polish the weaker points until they fall flat a few times.
If they thought your riddle perplexing, just wait until they hear this....
Strike with the Confound skill
Confound the Fools
You have come to believe that confusion is only scratching the surface. With a bit of work, you could stupify them where they stand.
You have refined your skill with Heart Seeker.

The name of Bard will live long in the memories and hearts of the Free Peoples. The same name can strike fear into the hearts of those who walk in shadows, and in their terror, they leave themselves vulnerable to the strongest attacks of the Hunter's art.
Complete Shot Through the Heart
Strike with Heart Seeker
Heart of the Bard
Follow in the steps of Bard himself and the servants of evil may grow to fear your name as well.
'You didn't seriously think they all keep their heart in the same place did you? Those that have one at all can be cagey about those sorts of things down here....' -- Jóngir, Cavern-hunter
Strike with Heart-seeker
Shot through the Heart
Earn a name for yourself and improve the reliability of your most deadly attack.
'I've even shared a trail with one or two bow-masters who carried no blades at all. They were the most frightening of all.'-- Seeker, Spider-bane, Mirkwood
Strike foes with your Barbed Arrow
Barbed Hindrance
Train hard to improve the snare on your Barbed Arrow, to help keep your prey at a comfortable distance from you.
You have made your traps more durable, ensuring they function more reliably.
It takes practiced skill to lay a trap in the midst of a fray, but the benefits are worth the hours spent in practice.
Complete Sturdy Traps
Use your Set Trap or Set Snare skills
Combat Traps
Master the art of trap-setting to be able to deploy them no matter the distractions.
Precision aim comes from training and knowledge of your foe. Know your enemy, know where to send your arrow to cause the greatest result, and be able to let fly with confidence and precision.
Achieve critical hits with your bow
Critical Eye
Develop the eye to spot and target the weak points of your foes more reliably.
Time spent in the wild acquaints the hunter to many forms of animal-emotions. Survival in the wild oft teaches the hunter to shape or inspire that emotion that suits their needs.
Strike with Bard's Arrow or Cry of the Predator
Strong Intimidation
Strike fear into the heart of your enemies and learn what it is that makes them flee.
'Have...some...mercy!'-- Alobri, the Zealous
Achieve critical hits with Merciful Shot
The Quality of Mercy
The quality of your shot must not strain your bow. The strain on your target is another matter altogether.
Drawing, aiming, and firing at speed is an act of skill and of will. With enough training, the petty distractions of battle will not disrupt your perfect form.
Use the Needful Haste skill
Resolute Aim
Cultivate the precise and dextrous movements to draw and fire at speed, no matter the distraction.
'Never death, never defeat, never despair. These are not permitted by the Warden...your cause is greater than these.' -- Kais, the Ironhand-warden
Strike with War-cry
Strong Voice
Let loose the cry of war and see your enemy's resolve erode.
As you show your confidence, let doubt grow within your enemy.
Strike with Brink of Victory
In the face of your confidence, let your opponent's own surety drain away.
The reach of the spear extends to the courage of your enemy. They know that that they are not beyond the touch of its point.
Strike with The Dark Before Dawn
Deadly Thrust
Your spear-thrust will weaken your foe's armour.
Your mastery of the quick thrust will be a boon to you in battles to come.
Strike with Quick Thrust, Quick Toss, or Quick Stab
Efficient Thrust
A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.
Let the spear drop among your foes, a herald of your arrival.
Strike with javelin skills
Expert Hurler
In the way of the spear, one always desires to have the option of using the best attack at the right time.
'Nothing made in this age is without some flaw...do you think something fashioned by these base creatures would be an exception?' -- Krom, Vault-warden
Achieve critical hits with Critical Strike
Find Weakness
A well-placed hit may be reveal your foe's weaknesses.
Master the passage of the fist, and it shall become inescapable.
Strike with Surety of Death, Resolution, or Spear of Virtue
Force of Personality
Lead with the fist, and the rest will follow.
Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden...you truly have a fist of legend.
Strike with Exultation of Battle or Desolation
Master of the Fist
Master the Way of the Fist.
Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden...you have become an expert of the spear.
Strike with Mighty Blow, Wall of Steel, or Boar's Rush
Master of the Spear
Master the Way of the Spear.
You have become more proficient with spears.
Fall from the sky and find the heart of your enemy.
Complete Expert Hurler
Strike with Ambush
Mighty Throw
The point may always be made sharper.
Your mastery of the precise blow will be a boon to you in battles to come.
Strike with Precise Blow
A Keen Response
A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.
Skill in gambits mean that every form may be an advantage to you.
Strike with Deft Strike
Skill and Power
Even a routine attack may become more powerful.
Sear your foe with the light of justice, let it expose their weaknesses.
Strike with Fierce Resolve
Terrible Visage
Let your enemy look upon your face and see the fear spread across theirs.
Soldier on just a little longer and see it carry you through the battle.
Strike with Safe-guard
Never Say Die
Take respite, however brief, and you can fight on.
The well-springs of your morale flow stronger.
Strike with Persevere
Take your foe off their feet to allow yourself to recover.
Choice words and gestures can focus the foe wonderfully upon yourself.
Strike with Warden's Taunt, Warden's Aim, or Warden's Scorn
Deadly Insult
Do not allow your foe to think of any target but yourself.
A lighter shield or a stronger arm? You wield the shield with efficiency and efficacy.
Strike with Shield Up
Efficient Shield-work
Bring up your shield and never let it falter.
A battle is not as satisfying until the enemy will endanger himself to fight you.
Strike with Goad
Know Your Enemy
Taunt your foe into error.
Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden,...you have achieved excellence with the shield.
Strike with Shield Mastery, Celebration of Skill, or Dance of War
Master of the Shield
Master the Way of the Shield.
'Sometimes, your shield is like other weapons, too. Good for hitting things...and usually a little surprising.' -- Jeb Wheaton, Warden of the Trollshaws
Strike with Shield-bash, Behind the Shield, or Shield-blast
Present your foe with your shield...to his face.
Your shield is a weapon, too, but it is used against weapons.
Block attacks
Skilful Blocking
Blocking is an art cultivated with practice.
Watchfulness in battle serves you well and those in your charge.
Strike with Defensive Strike
Wary Blocks
Strike with your defence foremost in your mind.
If your foe does not understand you, it may be that the connotation of your words was too confusing.
Have your Battle skills resisted
Master of Connotation
Your understanding of inference and connotation is improved by your foe's lack of understanding.
You have refined your skill at writing calming verses in battle.
Welcome words can be given to those in need with less notice taken by those who would not see them sent.
Complete Linnod of Subtlety
Use Calming Verse
Linnod of Peace
Improve your collection of pacifying and calming texts.
When you know your purpose, you can craft your words with intent to be effective and yet cunningly subtle.
Use Calming Verse
Linnod of Subtlety
There are ways you can put an aggressive bent to your soothing letters, allowing your invectives to burn as hot, but anger less.
Tragedy in literature can tug at the heartstrings...tragedy in the world can tug down fortified walls.
Critical Hits with Fury of the Storm skills
Master of Tragedy
Your studies in the construction of tragedy can have tremendous impact upon your foes.

The cold bites and the fire burns, but why would not tongues of flame also bear teeth? Fire and frost are not so different in their harsher aspects--though inimical to one another, they may be doubly so to those afflicted by them.
Strike with Writ of Fire or Writ of Cold
Use of offensive writs may reveal the sympathies and shared nature between the two.
'I find that necessity is an excellent motivator.' -- Gronir, dwarf stone-keeper
Use Self-motivation
Overflowing Confidence
You draw strength from within and find motivation that will carry you further than before.
If only your foes would learn to fear your reach, they might realize there is no place where they are safe when assailing you.
Strike with Shocking Touch
Confounding Principles
Improve the effect your touch can have upon your foe.
Grave portents may give the uncertain pause, but with practiced eye, foresight may come more swiftly to sight.
Use Visions and Foretellings skills
The Prophetic Word
Practice the art of casting your vision forwards, and you shall be able to do it with greater frequency.
Wrath, like fire, may burn bright but cold...or hot and nigh invisible. With your rage channelled, you control the venting of your anger and stoke the fires as you wish.
Strike with Wrath of Flame skills
Tale of Rage
Learn to let your temper loose in your writing, and it shall burn through to your foes.
'If you cannot endure the heat, stay of the library' -- Ciryalen, Rune-keeper in the north
Strike with Fiery Ridicule
Conflagration of Runes
With practice, you can kindle flame from fragments faster and with less effort.
Fire weakens as it burns, reducing your foe's protections against fire.
Strike with Smouldering Wrath
Scathing Retort
Kindle the fires of your passion to increase your art's impact.
Insults, as burns, may fade slowly from memory and leave scars longer still.
Strike with Writ of Fire
Writ of Blazing Fire
Your fires can burn longer still, if you only find the right words.
You have learned to leave your foes with a memory of biting cold that can linger long in their mind...and their feet.
Strike with Chilling Rhetoric
Icy Discourse
The bite of cold can fade swiftly or slow. It is a matter of practice to let it linger.
An epic is sometimes best presented in a shorter form.
Use Epic for the Ages
Terse Narrative
You are able to convey epic meaning through fewer words.
Kindly do words come to those who need them and linger with care.
Use Mending Verse
Memorable Prose
Achieve greater heights of healing while practicing the inscription of words of healing and restoration.
Runes may bind the stone upon which they are written, preserving meaning and integrity.
Use Rune of Restoration
Rune of Endurance
Increase the resiliency of your Rune of Restoration.
As the runes may protect against ignorance, so may they also defend against the blade.
Use Word of Exaltation
Author of Exaltation
Increase the protection offered by your Word of Exaltation with a dedicated inscription.
Meaning within meaning and allusions away from the truth can work to a rune-keeper's advantage.
Use any Words of Grace skills
Master of Allusion
Your ability to write between the lines confounds your foes.
Unending discourse is your art, but it can sometimes take your foes by surprise. Of course, such is your aim.
Strike with Ceaseless Argument
Harsh Debate
Learn how to unsettle your foe with your unrelenting assertions.
The crash of thunder carries finality, and the silence that follows is broken only by receding echoes unto the horizon.
Strike with Epic Conclusion
Closing Remarks
Study how to make an epic conclusion to your arguments.
Few are prepared the first time they experience even the simplest of your runes.
Strike with Scribe's Spark
Thunderous Words
The spark may light the way to greater things.
Greatness can be seen in the details; great details can be seen in the world.
Use Fury of the Storm or Chill of Winter skills
Your narratives combine the chill of a winter night and the turbulence of the fiercest storm.
Dwarves from the Iron Hills, the Iron Garrison, have come to reclaim Moria. They soon learn that the task will not be easy....
The Iron Garrison has begun to establish itself within Moria, reclaiming the ancient realm of Durin's Folk....
Hope stirs in the hearts of the Longbeards as they advance against the many threats of Moria....
The Iron Garrison prepares for war as the evil lurking within Moria turns its gaze towards them....
The courage of the Iron Garrison is tested as it faces the wrath of the Orcs of Moria.
There are worse things in the depths of Moria than just Orcs....

The threshold of the western gate of Khazad-dûm, it was here that Durin completed his legendary journey through the heart of the mountains and came once again into the light of the sun, having discovered the place that would become the home of his peoples for ages to come.

The Dolven-view acts as a window to the Great Delving below. From here, dwarves could once be seen bustling to and fro, visiting the markets, libraries, and workshops of this once-lively cavern. Now there is only a long, lonely view of goblin-fires and vile insects crawling through the dark.
As the northern gate of the Great Delving, the Dwarf-lords' Gate provides the main passage for those seeking to reach Durin's Way.
The Lonely Span lies just beyond the eastern gate of the Great Delving. It is the only direct passage to the streets of Zelem-melek, and is where the nobles of Khazad-dûm once resided.

The great carvings on the walls of this ancient grotto represent the ancient dwarf-council that advised Durin and aided in the daily administration of Khazad-dûm. Many of these great carvings have been damaged by time and wear, though luckily the bridge that spans this space remains intact, even if somewhat perilous.

The grand plaza of Gazatmur was once the heart of the Great Delving, surrounded by some of the most prestigious institutions and finest architecture within Khazad-dûm. Now it has been overrun by a large goblin encampment that prevents the dwarves from regaining control of the Delving.

Shemeldurj was an unusual estate constructed by an eccentric but famous architect of the late Second Age. In a departure from classical dwarf-design, it features fanciful spans and buttresses that challenge the observer to seek around each turn and corner to discover where next it goes. Much of it lies in ruins, spoiled by time and the ravaging hands of goblins.

After the fall of Durin, terror grasped the dwarves of Moria, now seized by panic and fear. Good Náin took his father's place and strove to quell the menace that threatened his halls, wishing to restore peace to his brethren. His short reign was a valiant one, but he too fell to the Bane of Khazad-dûm.

While the Orcs are vast in number, the arrival of unexpected visitors in Moria has thrown them into chaos and confusion. Some fight among themselves for leadership, while others viciously aim to destroy any who intrude upon their domain.
Defeat Orcs in Moria

Vast Moria has been long abandoned by the dwarves, but for years uncounted the Orcs have infested its darkened tunnels. They have looted the ancient city of its riches and constructed their own great warrens in and beneath the works of the dwarves.
With every passing day, it seems that more Orcs boil up from the depths of the mines, every last one of them fixed on the slaughter of any who trespass upon their domain.
Defeat Orcs in Moria
Orc-slayer (Advanced)

Rumour has it that there are many groups of Orcs in Moria whose numbers could stand to be thinned: there are those that are native to Moria, those in scattered clans in the deepest caverns, and another large detachment, the Durub, who may have come more recently under orders from Mordor itself.

Here it was that the Company of the Ring fended off a pack of Shadow-wargs sent by Sauron to hunt down the Ring.
The Wargs were at last driven off when Gandalf the Grey caused a powerful fire to blaze forth, a fire which ruined the wooded hilltop.

It was here that the Company of the Ring set camp in the Redhorn Gate. Gandalf was forced to show forth his power to light the fire, revealing himself to all who had the ability to recognize it, putting the Company in jeopardy.
This gateway leads up the Sirannon to the Hollin Gate.
This camp-site marks a place where the Company of the Ring stayed during their journey through Hollin. A careless hobbit left his mark, as well.
The Company of the Ring rested here before continuing on to the Redhorn Gate. Sam Gamgee clearly took the opportunity to provide a fine meal for the Company....

You have journeyed into Eregion, the ancient home of the Elves who now dwell in Rivendell. Elrond's people seek to hide the passage of the Company of the Ring, but also to drive forth the forces of Saruman the White....
Complete quests within Eregion
Silent and Restless

Elrond of Rivendell has sent scouts into Eregion to cover the path of the Company of the Ring and also to drive forth the spies of Saruman the White from the ancient home of the Noldor in Middle-earth.

The Elves of Rivendell are grateful for your assistance as they strive with the evil drawn to Eregion by Amarthiel's discovery of the Ring-forges and the passage of the Company of the Ring, while they continue their mission to cover the trail of the Company.

Regiments of black crows have been seen throughout Eregion. They are not native to the land, but have come out of Fangorn and Dunland. You long ago lost count of how many of these foul creatures have fallen before you -- and yet their numbers seem undiminished.

The Uruk Logon was sent to Glâd Ereg with a company of Wood-trolls to bring the forest beneath the White Hand of Saruman.
Fauldush is a warlord of a strange and powerful breed of Orc who serve Saruman the White: the Uruk-hai.
Shatogtar, a warlord of the Uruk-hai, once led the forces of the White Hand at Barad Morlas.
The defeat of Pizumu the Spy-master will greatly hinder Saruman's efforts in Eregion.
Gâmzhurm the Uruk is the driving force behind the Dunlendings who occupy the encampment of Porth Cadlus. It is the fear of this beast that keeps them from returning to their homes.
The half-orcs of Târ Stazg will fall into disarray without the leadership of Akashpug.
Râkhuga was the leader of the Scouts of Saruman seeking after the One Ring in Eregion. His death will be a mighty blow to the White Hand.
