Farms and Crofts of the Eastemnet
Discover the farms of the Eastemnet.
Discover the farms of the Eastemnet.
The dead stir in the barrows of the Dwolung Hole in the Wold, never a good sign to the Men of Rohan, who are naturally superstitious.
Wódscrafen is home to the Dead who walk, though they should be asleep in their tombs. What wakes the sleeping draugar from their rest?
The Seething Mire lies near Langhold, once a fair Gondorian structure, now naught but ruins overrun by salamanders and their nests.
A freestanding stone tower, Minas Rant is a relic of the ancient armies of Gondor that once protected the lands now called the Norcrofts.

The Red Fields were once ideal lands for growing crops and raising livestock, but became the primary battlegrounds of the first of the recent Orc-invasions. The area received its nickname due to the bloodshed incurred by mounted Orc-archers.

You have found the grave of the father of Fastred, the previous Reeve of the Sutcrofts. Fastred often visits to pay his respects and to mercilessly hunt any Orc that dares to stray too close to his father's resting place.

Alas for Thornhope, newly arrived upon the list of dead and abandoned places in the Eastemnet. Thornhope was a thriving city once, but now it is naught but death and ruin, a hollow reminder of the good people that lived there.

Tombs of the Men of Gondor can sometimes be found in secluded corners of Rohan. Such crypts often attract adventurers who seek treasures of the Second Age, but they are frequently filled only with danger and death.
Byrgenstow was once an ancient burial tomb belonging to the ancestors of the Dunlendings. Now it teems with evil in the form of the draugar.

You have discovered Cuthard's Grave in the graveyard near Forlaw.
You have discovered Grimgar's Grave in the graveyard near Forlaw.
You have discovered Humbald's Grave in the graveyard near Forlaw.
There are many of Reeve Gárwig's family buried in the graveyard outside of Forlaw. Many of these graves are relatively fresh.

Edsig's Farm is one of the larger farms in the Fallows, but was recently abandoned with the attack on Forlaw. Nobody from Edsig's farm returned to Forlaw or made it to Thrymm's Farm, and are assumed dead.
Gárnoth's Farm is one of the largest in the Fallows, but has been on the decline since Gárnoth died to Brúlk. It is well-known in Wildermore for the quality of cattle raised at the farm.
Thrymm's Farm is the largest farm in the Fallows, and at its peak, was a major supplier to Forlaw and the northern cities of Wildermore.
Cuthbald's Farm is one of the three smaller farms in the Fallows. When Cuthbald died at an early age this farm went to Gárferth's control, though it suffered due to his focus being elsewhere.
Gársig's Farm is one of the smaller farms of the Fallows, and is furthest from the city of Forlaw. The farm's distance from Forlaw is symbolic of the relationship between him and his father.
Gárferth's Farm is one of the smaller farms of the Fallows. Gárferth has always made training as a warrior and protecting Forlaw his top priority, and his two farms suffered for it.

Farms of the Fallows

Gárwig gave each of his sons a section of the Fallows as they came of age. Each of them built or inherited a farm on their land, and some were more successful than others at producing goods for Forlaw and Wildermore.

Discover the sites of Núrzum's destruction in Wildermore
It is clear that Núrzum paused in this spot to hunt a messenger from Forlaw and mangle his horse.
Núrzum paused here to get a good look at Forlaw, and his footprints lead the other way.
Orcs have set up a small encampment encircling these ice-spires, letting their guard down in the shadow of Núrzum's presence.
Núrzum stood outside of Dunfast and tossed about trees and boulders as if they were a child's toys.
Núrzum carved a path of terror through Balewood, freezing the forest and paving the way for the White Hand invasion of Wildermore.

Settlements of Wildermore

Discover the settlements of the people of Wildermore.
This small town in the High Knolls once offered a tall view upon all of Wildermore, but the people who lived here were slain to the very last by the Uruks from Isengard.
Byre Tor, a wild stronghold in the tors of the High Knolls, is now inhabited by the enemy, its banners defiled by the White Hand.
A makeshift camp led by a champion of Wildermore, this settlement was built recently to prepare the Rohirrim of Writhendowns for an impending White Hand attack.
A small camp hidden amongst the outskirts of the Balewood, Cerdic and his men keep watch on the nearby road for sign of more White Hand invaders.
Iothete, a villager from Dunfast, abandoned his home long ago and left his people, coming to this remote spot in the Elderwood.

Discover Drû Vádokan
Discover where the foes of the Rohirrim dwell in Wildermore.
Now inhabited by all manner of unnatural evil, this abandoned fishing village was once the main source of food for the people of Scylfig.
This substantial White Hand settlement occupies a strategic location in the Writhendowns, and aims to keep a watchful eye on the city of Forlaw.
Built atop the remains of an elder Huorn of Fangorn, this camp is now home to the White Hand forces in Balewood.
Snow-cats of the High Knolls prowl in great numbers on this snowy hill, starving as their prey die from the cold.
A White Hand outpost erected recently to scout Scylfig for the coming attack.

You are now known to the Eorlingas.
You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Eorlingas
Known to the Eorlingas
Your name is now known amongst the Eorlingas, and they know that you act in their interest.
You have become a welcome friend among the Eorlingas.
You must earn Friend standing with the Eorlingas
Friend to the Eorlingas
You are now considered a friend to the Eorlingas of the Westemnet.
You are now a trusted ally among the Eorlingas
You must earn Ally standing with the Eorlingas
Ally to the Eorlingas
When the Eorlingas are in need of aid, they expect that you will find your way to the forefront of battle to assist them.
There is nowhere you can travel within Eastfold, Kingstead, and Broadacres where you are not known. The people feel a deep kinship with you.
You must earn Kindred standing with the Eorlingas
Kindred to the Eorlingas
You may not have been born an Eorling, but you are welcome wherever you go in the eastern Westemnet.
You are now known to the Helmingas.
You must earn Acquaintance standing with the Helmingas

Your name is now known amongst the Helmingas, and they know that you act in their interest.
You have become a welcome friend among the Helmingas.
You must earn Friend standing with the Helmingas
Friend to the Helmingas
You are now considered a friend to the Helmingas of the Westemnet.
You are now a trusted ally among the Helmingas
You must earn Ally standing with the Helmingas
Ally to the Helmingas
When the Helmingas are in need of aid, they expect that you will find your way to the forefront of battle to assist them.
There is nowhere you can travel within Stonedeans and Westfold where you are not known. The people feel a deep kinship with you.
You must earn Kindred standing with the Helmingas
Kindred to the Helmingas
You may not have been born a Helming, but you are welcome wherever you go in the western Westemnet.

The faster you can put multiple arrows in your enemy, the faster they hit the ground.
Strike enemies with Quick Shot
Quick as the Wind
Hunters who can release arrows the fastest tend to be the first to eat.
This is your objective description.
No one is likely to mistake you for a master of the sword, but they will learn to respect your blade nonetheless or suffer the consequences.
Strike enemies with Blindside
Attacking one's blind side may not be the most valiant tactic, but it is nevertheless effective.
This is your objective description.
Protecting another sometimes means removing threats from the field in the most expedient manner possible.
Use Sweeping Cut
Swept Away
You have vanquished many foes with your Sweeping Cut and many more will fall.
Your second wind endures through long battle and renews your strength.
Use Charge
First Line of Defence
A Guardian would rather be nowhere else than the front line, ready for battle.
This is your objective description.
Strike your foes not just with force, but with contempt. Few enemies can stand to turn from an opponent who treats them with disdain, and so you can arrange their downfall.
Use Retaliation
Retaliatory Strike
A Guardian is always a fierce opponent, but never more so than when they are angered.
This is your objective description.
Block attacks
Efficient Shield-work
Bring up your shield and never let it falter.
Drawing, aiming, and firing at speed is an act of skill and of will. With enough training, the petty distractions of battle will not disrupt your perfect form.
Use the Dazing Blow skill
Dazed and Confused
A dazed and confused enemy is a much easier target than one who is alert and aware.

At the height of their power, the ancient Dúnedain held great stores of lore, and unlike the Elves whose memories span Ages and thus commit little to writing, the Dúnedain wrote many volumes describing this lore. Most were lost in great calamities past, but some survive today and from these the Lore-masters learn a great deal.
Use Signs of Power or Battle
Dúnadan-learning
While the Elves were long known as masters of lore, the Dúnedain of old were very near their equals in many arts.
Use Signs of Power or Battle to improve your skill.

There are signs and sigils that can be used by the Wise to speak to the heart of a wild creature without words, but those who truly understand this art know that it is not the sign that speaks most loudly to the beast, but your own heart.
Summon a companion.
Master of Beasts
Of the magicks that can be wielded by Man or Elf, the hearts of beasts are among the most closely tied to the visible world, and so there are many who strive to master them.
This is your objective description.
Lightning is among the most powerful forces of nature. Mastering it is no small feat, but the benefits of doing so are not to be underestimated.
Use Lightning Strike
A Shocking Strike
Call upon the power of lightning to strike your foes.
This is your objective description.

Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the sudden fury of storms in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which makes the sudden echoes of the storm even more dangerous to your enemies than before.
Strike with Storm-lore or Lightning Strike
Improved Storm-lore
Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the essence of fire in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which may raise the temperature of the air about your enemies still higher.
Strike with Fire-lore or Sign of Battle: Wizard's Fire
The Study of Fire-lore
Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of the essence of frost in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which may lower the temperature of the air about your enemies still lower.
Strike with Frost-lore or Gust of Wind
The Study of Frost-lore
Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.
It takes practiced skill to lay a trap in the midst of a fray, but the benefits are worth the hours spent in practice.
Use your Tripwire skill
Combat Traps
Very few keep their eyes down to look for a tripwire, and if they do, they'll never see you coming.
There is more than brute strength involved. No one can hold the string back so far for so long. Such a pull must be followed by a swift and sure release before fatigue spoils the shot.
Use Penetrating Shot
Strong Draw
The strength required to pull a bowstring back with sufficient power to penetrate armour is sorely underestimated by warriors who do not understand the art of the Hunter.
This is your objective description.
Your eyes and ears are your ultimate allies. No detail must escape you, whether it be at five-hundred paces or mere inches before you, as you study the earth and the stories that it can tell.
Use Tracking skills
Heightened Senses
Hunters are often renowned for their ability to see what is hidden and follow signs that few others are even aware of.
This is your objective description.

It is all in the knots. Some are strong, but can be pulled apart by great strength or desperate struggles. Others seem to hold but loosely until they are pulled against, at which point they tighten like a deadly noose.
Use your Set Trap or Triple Trap skills
Sturdy Traps
Traps are not by their nature terribly dependable weapons. They are nevertheless effective.
This is your objective description.
You have found that there are few magicks that can duplicate the effects of a good rap upon the skull with a stout piece of oak.
Use Staff-strike against your foes
Master of the Staff
Even a lore-master will occasionally find himself face-to-face with the enemy. At times like these, a sturdy oaken staff may take on a simpler and most vital role.
This is your objective description.
You have learned that your enemies' greatest weakness can be their pride. You have mastered the art of turning their rage and ignorance against them.
Use Ignore the Pain
Phantom Pain
In the heat of battle, pain is to be ignored. You can lick your wounds when your foe has fallen.
There is a special rage that is reserved for those who would threaten the lives of a Guardian's companions. You have felt its heat often enough to know its power.
Use War-chant, Thrust, or Smashing Stab
The Best Defence is a Better Offence
While you are known for your defensive technique, you are not to be underestimated when on the offensive.
This is your objective description.

The world throws a great many things your way -- most of them are heavy, sharp, or on fire, and all of them are addressed to you with ill will and poor tidings. It is best just to take these things in stride.
Use Guardian's Pledge, Protection, or Protection by the Sword
Many would call Guardians fatalistic. Perhaps they should try holding a bridge alone against countless Orcs?
This is your objective description.
Your taunts and jibes draw the wrath of your foes upon you, distracting them from your allies.
Use Challenge, Fray the Edge, or Engage
Grim Challenge
A Guardian's task is to protect his allies from the assaults of their foes.
This is your objective description.
There is no thrill to battle without a large audience to appreciate your handiwork. If that audience is composed mainly of blood-foes, then so much the better.
Use Thrill of Danger, Overwhelm, or Litany of Defiance in battle
Heat of Battle
A Guardian's most important role is to ensure the lives of their companions. A Guardian who forgets this creed is no Guardian at all, but a preening fool.
This is your objective description.
Few things sharpen the wit or quicken the feet so effectively as a rain of arrows and blades.
Parry enemy attacks
Quick Wrist
A sound defence is often more important than an explosive offence.
This is your objective description.
Few things sharpen the wit or quicken the feet so effectively as a rain of arrows and blades.
Block enemy attacks
Blocking Force
Above all, a Guardian must be where they are needed and quickly, for your companions are not so sturdy as you.
This is your objective description.
The guardian knows patience and possesses great reserves of endurance. You know how to whittle away at the composure and control of your foes until they undo themselves.
Strike with Hammer Down, Juggernaut, or Cataclysmic Shout
Final Straw
Practice harrying your foes, encouraging them to expose their vulnerabilities.
Calming your mind and regaining strength in a moments notice will make you a formidable foe.
Use the skill Focus
Focused and Ready
Being able to gain focus in the midst of chaos is a true art that few can master.
This is your objective description.
The art of the bow is both simple and elegant once it is truly mastered.
Strike enemies with Swift Bow, Barbed Arrow, or Lingering Wound
Swift and Sharp
It is said that the Elves developed the art of the bow long ago, but the old tales do not say who among them first mastered it.
This is your objective description.

Those who understand darkness and power and the dreadful temptation that it poses to the Wise have learned only that they must always stand vigilant against such forces and that there is no final lesson...save for failure.
Draw Power from your enemies
Power and Wisdom

There is much to be learned from your enemies, but every Lore-master must decide for themselves how deeply to delve into the darkness. Every being has their limits, and it is never clear when you have taken a step too far until it is too late to return.
This is your objective description.

All of nature speaks, but to most its voices speak in unyielding riddles. Long ago, the Valar taught the Eldar the truth of some of these riddles. That lore has been passed down through many generations of the wise, for those who are willing to listen.
Use your Lore Skills against enemies
Deep Lore
The elements of nature can be truly understood by few and to those few alone will they lend their power.
This is your objective description.
Only through practice can we come to understand the subtlety of our knowledge.
Use Burning Embers or Sticky Gourd, or either of the Improved versions of these skills
Tactically Adept
Lore-masters are dreaded for their ability to ignite any object in their hands.
This is your objective description.
You've mastered your Inner Flame, able to spread the benefits to nearby allies.
Use Inner Flame
Improved Inner Flame
Channeling your Inner Flame takes great effort and concentration, but the reward can be quite enlightening.

Sickness is an invisible malaise touching man and beast alike, but it is itself alive. The Lore-master who fully understands its nature can turn the sickness against itself, greatly magnifying their curative powers.
Use Knowledge of Cures
Proof Against All Ills
Disease and illness has always been a favoured weapon of the Enemy, and Lore-masters have long striven to contest this power to greater or lesser success.
This is your objective description.
One must take care when employing the sign of command. The imposition of one's will upon another can leave a lasting mark upon both.
Strike with Sign of Power: Command
Improved Sign of Power: Command
You have heard that there may be a more complete form of the sign you uncovered previously.

Incarnate beings -- even the Elves -- were never truly meant to channel the primal energies from which the world is formed, and so it tears at them even as they strive to master it. As you have learned more about the nature of power you have learned to let these powers flow through you with less difficulty, though great care is still called for.
Use Wisdom of the Council
Awareness of Body
Clearly, if one is to learn to properly manipulate the forces of nature and other lore, one must first understand the true nature of power.
This is your objective description.

'I believe that the path to knowledge is a road with no end. I suppose, therefore, that I will probably never get there. That is why I take frequent stops to read, have a bite to eat, lend a hand here or there, that sort of thing. Just because I take my time about it does not mean I have not gotten anywhere. There are secret things that I could show you, but...well, you would probably not enjoy the lesson.' -- Gregori, Wanderer from the Forest
Strike with Wizard's Frost or Wizard's Fire
Improved Sign of Battle
Continue your study of ancient signs and the power they represent.

Those who call upon the knowledge of the ancient world understand that much of this lore is tied to the ever-shifting forces of life and nature and so can call upon those powers to rejuvenate themselves even as they wield them.
Use Share the Power
Knowledge of the Past
Much of what simpler folk call magic is tied to the life of the world and is intertwined with it since the time before days.
This is your objective description.

For the novice, the kindling of hope in the heart of another seems a monumental and draining task. For the master who understands the true nature of sacrifice, it becomes a simple and fulfilling exertion.
Use Light of Hope
Light of Hope
Hope is so much more than a naive emotion or dream...it is a wellspring of great power.
This is your objective description.

Many men believe that being in harmony with nature means being at peace. Nothing could be further from the truth, for it is nature's way to express change, often in the most chaotic and violent manners imaginable. Interestingly, most sailors seem to grasp this lesson quite readily.
Use Cracked Earth
Harmony with Nature

Lore-masters are often said to be in harmony with the forces of nature. It is sometimes difficult to understand what is so harmonious about the earth-rents they just ripped open under an enemy's feet however.
This is your objective description.
You have discovered that in the violent confusion of battle, simple distractions can be used to conceal the power of the ancient lore as it is bent to the purpose of war.
Use Blinding Flash against your enemies
Subtlety of Wisdom
Many Lore-masters choose to forsake the garish magics of thunderous fire and glamour, for they may bring the wrath of the Enemy quickly upon them.
This is your objective description.
Tending to the injured and sick is often an exhausting process, but for those like yourself who have taken the lessons of kindness and sacrifice to heart it is also very rewarding.
Heal your fellows with Knowledge of Cures
Among the most respected forms of learning is that of healing. Every Lore-master should strive to understand this fundamental art.
This is your objective description.
Your studies have given you a deeper, fuller knowledge of wind in the natural world. You have uncovered much lore, the use of which brings stronger gusts to hamper your foe's movements even more.
Strike with Gust of Wind
The Study of Wind-lore
Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.
'Handling this substance can be, well, a sticky problem. Fortunately, I have perfected a mixture that surmounts the problem. The solution? Now, that would be telling....' -- Vistan, Master of Robes
Strike with Sticky Tar
The Secret of Tar
Refine the quality of your sticky mixtures to make them easier to prepare.
Many warriors seek to turn the tide of battle with bellows and bravery. You find that that fear of an unseen enemy can unnerve foes even more effectively than the sight of a charging madman.
Use Beneath Notice
Stealthy Shot
Many fear Hunters not for the death they bring, but for the silence with which it approaches.
This is your objective description.
The ability of traps to cause damage is not limited to the jaws of death.
Use your Pinning Shot, Explosive Arrow, or Split Shot skills
Skill Shot
Almost anyone can learn to fire an arrow, but few can shoot like you.
This is your objective description.
To the eye of the trained Hunter, it is clear when an arrow has found its true mark, and another must swiftly follow the first.
Land critical hits with your Bow Skills
Deadly Precision
Hunters cannot rely on brute force to achieve victory in battle, so it is important to find your enemy's weaknesses.
This is your objective description.
'You didn't seriously think they all keep their heart in the same place did you? Those that have one at all can be cagey about those sorts of things down here....' -- Jóngir, Cavern-hunter
Strike with Heart Seeker
Shot Through The Heart
Earn a name for yourself and improve the reliability of your most deadly attack.
Many across Middle-earth would be wise to befriend a Hunter with a mastery of poisons.
Use Purge Poison
Poison? What Poison?
There are many different kinds of poison in Middle-earth. Knowing how to cure them is a life long task.
This is your objective description.
'Have...some...mercy!'-- Alobri, the Zealous
Achieve critical hits with Merciful Shot
The Quality of Mercy
The quality of your shot must not strain your bow. The strain on your target is another matter altogether.

The novice Hunter focuses on the art of striking their target true. This is of no concern to you. You are more interested in the art of striking that slot below the shoulder, no wider than an acorn, that opens as they raise their swords.
Critically hit enemies with Penetrating Shot
True Shot
Few of your foes are foolish enough to take to the field of battle without armour, but every armour has its flaws.
This is your objective description.
Time spent in the wild acquaints the hunter to many forms of animal-emotions. Survival in the wild oft teaches the hunter to shape or inspire that emotion that suits their needs.
Use Bard's Arrow, Rain of Arrows, or Blood Arrow
Tools of the Trade
Show your enemies all the different ways you can be dangerous.
Precision aim comes from training and knowledge of your foe. Know your enemy, know where to send your arrow to cause the greatest result, and be able to let fly with confidence and precision.
Use Upshot, The One Trap, or Rapid Fire
Rapid Fire
Your attacks are quick, numerous, and without mercy.
On more than one occasion, you have found it necessary to throw artistry and caution to the winds and simply turn your foes into walking pincushions.
Use Intent Concentration
Total Attention
Sometimes taking that extra second to concentrate and focus on your target makes all the difference.
This is your objective description.
A disabled foe, is a dead foe.
Use Low Cut
Cut Them Down
The Hunter depends on disabling their enemies at key moments in combat to emerge victorious.
This is your objective description.
The deadliest Hunters are the ones you never see...
Use Camouflage
Sneaky Sneaky
Blending into your surroundings provides both defensive and strategic bonuses.

The name of Bard will live long in the memories and hearts of the Free Peoples. The same name can strike fear into the hearts of those who walk in shadows, and in their terror, they leave themselves vulnerable to the strongest attacks of the Hunter's art.
Use Burn Hot, Rain of Thorns, or Barrage
Scorching Rain
Whether they burn hot or fall in a rain of arrows, they will fall.
Your mastery of the precise blow will be a boon to you in battles to come.
Strike with Precise Blow
A Keen Response
A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.
Skill in gambits mean that every form may be an advantage to you.
Strike with Deft Strike
Skill and Power
Even a routine attack may become more powerful.
Choice words and gestures can focus the foe wonderfully upon yourself.
Strike with Warden's Taunt or Warden's Aim
Deadly Insult
Do not allow your foe to think of any target but yourself.
Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden...you have become an expert of the spear.
Strike with Mighty Blow, Wall of Steel, or Boar's Rush
Master of the Spear
Master the Way of the Spear.
Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden...you truly have a fist of legend.
Strike with Exultation of Battle or Desolation
Master of the Fist
Master the Way of the Fist.
The well-springs of your morale flow stronger.
Strike with Persevere
Take your foe off their feet to allow yourself to recover.
As you show your confidence, let doubt grow within your enemy.
Strike with Brink of Victory
On the Brink of Victory
In the face of your confidence, let your opponent's own surety drain away.
'Nothing made in this age is without some flaw...do you think something fashioned by these base creatures would be an exception?' -- Krom, Vault-warden
Achieve critical hits with Shield Slam
Find Weakness
A well-placed hit may be reveal your foe's weaknesses.
'Never death, never defeat, never despair. These are not permitted by the Warden...your cause is greater than these.' -- Kais, the Ironhand-warden
Strike with War-cry
Strong Voice
Let loose the cry of war and see your enemy's resolve erode.
Watchfulness in battle serves you well and those in your charge.
Strike with Defensive Strike
Wary Blocks
Strike with your defence foremost in your mind.
Your mastery of the quick thrust will be a boon to you in battles to come.
Strike with Quick Thrust or Quick Toss
Efficient Thrust
A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.
Master the passage of the fist, and it shall become inescapable.
Strike with Surety of Death, Resolution, or Spear of Virtue
Force of Personality
Lead with the fist, and the rest will follow.
The reach of the spear extends to the courage of your enemy. They know that that they are not beyond the touch of its point.
Dark Before Dawn
Strike with The Dark Before Dawn
Your spear-thrust will weaken your foe's armour.
Sear your foe with the light of justice, let it expose their weaknesses.
Strike with Fierce Resolve
Terrible Visage
Let your enemy look upon your face and see the fear spread across theirs.
Soldier on just a little longer and see it carry you through the battle.
Strike with Safe-guard
Never Say Die
Take respite, however brief, and you can fight on.
A battle is not as satisfying until the enemy will endanger himself to fight you.
Strike with Goad
Know Your Enemy
Taunt your foe into error.
'Sometimes, your shield is like other weapons, too. Good for hitting things...and usually a little surprising.' -- Jeb Wheaton, Warden of the Trollshaws
Strike with Shield-bash or Behind the Shield
Present your foe with your shield...to his face.
Fall from the sky and find the heart of your enemy.
Strike with Ambush
Mighty Throw
The point may always be made sharper.
Mastery allows you to perform beyond the ability of even the experienced Warden,...you have achieved excellence with the shield.
Strike with Shield Mastery, Celebration of Skill, or Dance of War
Master of the Shield
Master the Way of the Shield.
Let the spear drop among your foes, a herald of your arrival.
Strike with javelin skills
Expert Hurler
In the way of the spear, one always desires to have the option of using the best attack at the right time.
Your shield is a weapon, too, but it is used against weapons.
Block attacks
Skilful Blocking
Blocking is an art cultivated with practice.
'Do not give in to despair, friend. Trust in me as I trust in you, and we shall overcome even this.' -- Éadoin, Dawn-singer
Use any version of Raise the Spirit
Improved Raise the Spirit
Master the words that may raise the spirits of those who stand upon the edge of despair.
The stalwart are those who stand strong long after lesser men have abandoned hope.
Use Healing Skills
Enduring Morale
Increase your vigour and find greater well-springs of spirit within yourself.
As you have come to better understand the true nature of the darkness you fight, so have your songs come to dismay them all the more.
Use Minor Ballad
Light in the Dark
Many creatures of evil and darkness do not fare well before the beauty and light of music.
This is your objective description.
You have mastered the art of the Piercing Cry such that you can use it more frequently without the need to soothe your poor throat at the local pub.
Use Piercing Cry
Smooth Voice
The Piercing Cry is rough on the throat, making it difficult to utter too often without losing one's voice.
In time, you have learned to draw strength from your own songs of healing, and they no longer tire you as they once did.
Use your Healing and Motivation Skills
The songs of life are quite draining, and only the most experienced minstrels can use them for long.
This is your objective description.
You have trained your voice such that you can disorient your enemies with strange and painful tones.
Land Critical hits with Piercing Cry
It is said that minstrels who can maintain the most difficult keys can cause disorienting pain to their foes.
This is your objective description.
You have mastered the art of intertwining your individual ballads into a greater work to inspire the hearts of your fellows.
Use Ballads or Codas
Harmonious Melody
The magic of the voice is a delicate thing, easily disturbed by failures of harmony or rhythm.
This is your objective description.
There is piece of victory in every skilful swing of a sword. Draw heart from the strike, let it herald your ultimate triumph.
Strike enemies with Healer's Strike, Hero's Strike, or Dissonant Strike
Improved Herald's Strike
Be a herald of your opponent's defeat.
When all else fails, sing very loudly.
Use your Cries
Powerful Voice
Minstrels often find it difficult to make themselves heard over the din of battle.
This is your objective description.
You have realized that, like music, there is a rhythm and tempo to battle that you have begun to master.
Strike enemies with Healer's Strike, Hero's Strike, or Dissonant Strike
Herald's Hammer
In this time of strife, even a minstrel cannot travel the roads unarmed.
This is your objective description.
So much of fear and pain is a matter of perception, and with the strains of your voice you can make such perceptions easier to bear for those who weary of battle and war.
Use Song of Aid or Inspire Fellows
Heralded Saviour
It is believed that by lightening the heart with song, one can more easily weather the physical ills of the world.
This is your objective description.
It turns out that nothing strengthens the voice quite like yelling at the top of your lungs during the heat of battle.
Use Anthem of War
Strength of Voice
The most powerful music is also the most tiring, and it cannot be sustained for long.
Your audience may recall bits of a verse, but a bombastic finish is far more memorable.
Score Critical Hits with Codas
Spectacular Finish
A strong finish makes your words and melodies all the more potent.
Change Stances
Sometimes you have to work around a fickle crowd.
Dynamic Performance
Improvisation is a vital skill for any performer.
This is your objective description.

While this song is commonly heard in the midst of desperate battle, it is strangely among the most soothing of and restful of all melodies, and therein lies its power to restore the spirit of those on the edge of the void.
Use Enlivening Grace or Improved Enlivening Grace
Graceful Demeanour
For those who have lost all hope during battle, perhaps new hope can be kindled in between the notes of a song...
This is your objective description.
'Breath is the life we draw in and draw upon. So long as you draw breath, you have the power to act...and to save.' -- James Grant, Healer of Ills
Use your healing songs
Power of Song
Cultivate the endurance to last through any conflict.
The clash of clamour and battle shall be intensified by your songs, sending your foes down to swift defeat.
Use Melody of Battle, Echoes of Battle or Timeless Echoes of Battle
Improved Echoes of Battle
Let the calls of battle echo from the hills and mountains in a great clamour.
'Let us join the tale that never ends. It goes on and on, my friends. And so shall we.' -- Burt Nine-tales, Minstrel Tale-weaver
Tell a Story of Courage
Easing the fears of your allies is an important role in any fellowship.
It is said that there is an etherial chorus that underpins all that is real. By catching the faint strains of this ancient song, you can call upon your songs more quickly in the heat of battle.
Use Cry of the Chorus
Silver Tongue
Lately you have been hearing a faint strain of music, seemingly more beautiful even than that of the Elves. But where could it be coming from?
This is your objective description.
Motivational singing has been shown to be far more effective than motivational speaking.
Use Anthem of Prowess
Subtle Movements
Unfortunately, the old tales are filled with incidents of foolhardy minstrels finding themselves riddled with arrows as they bravely sing their last upon the field of battle.
It is said that this cry was used by Elves who had once laid eyes upon the isle of Valinor, far across the sea to the West.
Use Cry of the Valar
The Cry of the Valar is considered one of the most stirring pieces of music ever sung upon the battlefield.
This is your objective description.
Those who are composed with the resolve to face their greatest fears shall conquer them.
Use Anthem of Composure
Lyrics of Bravery
Become a master of your own will, and you will not so easily fall under the sway of others.
The veteran eye can sometimes see when a foe's strength starts to flag even before the enemy himself knows it.
Strike with Merciful Strike
Bountiful Mercy
Learn to identify the turning point in a foe's strength and strike.
In a sword-fight, it is usually a safe bet that the man without a blade is in a bad way. You, however, have learned how to hedge that bet better than most.
Use Riposte, Ferocious Strikes, or Raging Blade
Tight Grip
Practice your weapon-recovering strike; it could save your life...or a friend's.
You did not choose the path of the champion out of a finely honed sense of caution, or in hope of a long and healthy life. You seek to hear the vibrant song of battle.
Use Dire Need, Great Cleave, or Controlled Burn
Time of Need
Some champions have been known to hurl themselves into battle with such vigour that they injure themselves more grievously than the enemy does.
This is your objective description.
You have discovered a particular flow and momentum to battle that allows you to execute the Blade-storm with considerably less effort.
Raging Storm
Land critical blows with Blade-storm, Remorseless Strike or Raging Blade
The Champion has a number of skills at their disposal, but perhaps none more deadly than their remorseless nature.
This is your objective description.
With every attack there is an opening. If you are under attack from all sides, then you can keep yourself occupied taking advantage of all of them.
Use Clobber
There is no time like the present to do some clobbering.
This is your objective description.
Those who have become accomplished masters of the Blade-wall can use it to manoeuvre opponents into dangerous positions.
Critically hit enemies with Blade-wall
Flashing Blade
The Blade-wall is a staple of battle for champions, allowing them to engage multiple opponents in battle and evening the odds when outnumbered.
This is your objective description.
For those champions to whom battle is an old friend, the blood can be made to sing to the memory of old conflicts before your blade is even unsheathed.
Use Fight On
No Surrender
Sometimes you do not have time to work yourself up to a task; you must simply hurl yourself into the breach.
This is your objective description.
Your wild and vicious blows cause terrible wounds to your enemies.
Critically Hit enemies with Rend, Brutal Strikes or Bracing Attack
Deep Strikes
Deep wounds are deadly wounds. Many a warrior survives the battle, but not the night that follows.
This is your objective description.
You have learned a display of swordsmanship that enemies find intimidating, such that they fear to turn their back to you.
Strike with Wild Attack
Call of the Wild
Champions prefer to fight their enemies face-to-face, so that they may look their foes in the eye as they fall.
This is your objective description.
Some find the Champion's lust for battle to be distasteful. Too bad they do not know what they are missing.
Land Critical Hits using Wild Attack
Wild Thing
Food, drink, companionship -- for the Champion, all of these are second to the joys of battle...drink is a very close second though.
This is your objective description.
There is no holding back once the battle has been joined, no time to be clouded by restraint or hesitation. The time for caution is before, and the time for regret is after.
Land blows with Savage Strikes
Deadly Strikes
Champions are known for their reckless and powerful strikes in battle, cleaving any foolish enough to stand in their way.
This is your objective description.
Many of the nations of Middle-earth employ distinctive styles of horns. While some are imbued with a greater power than another, the power and will of the wielder can make up for much.
Strike with Horn of Gondor
Mighty Blast
You must master your horn-blowing technique to use the horns of the South Kingdom.

The Champion is acutely aware of his surroundings throughout battle. This sensitivity and understanding can allow more ready access to skills when a Champion's understanding and control has reached a greater level.
Use Champion's Duel, Fury of Blades, or Unbreakable
Battle Acumen
Master your understanding of battle and the space in which it takes place so that you can end battles more swiftly in the future.

'Why is it that the last thing anyone expects from me is a little self-control? Do you think anyone lasts particularly long swinging a pair of blades about your body without a little control?' -- Grímr, Champion of the Blue Mountains
Always in Control
Use Devastating Strike, Exchange of Blows, or Adamant
Master self-control, and many techniques will be possible that were not before.
It is true that sometimes success in battle may take a toll on the conscience of the victor. Not all enemies begin as such and even the champion, confident in his cause, may grieve for the fallen.
Hit enemies with True Heroics
Heroic Resolve
You are more than just a champion for the people of Middle Earth, you are a true hero.
Through grueling practice, you have refined your skill to inflict even greater damage and havoc upon your foes.
Use Blade-Storm, Remorseless Strike or Sudden Defence
Winds of the Storm
Blade-storm is one of the Champion's most impressive attacks, causing considerable havoc upon the field of battle.
This is your objective description.
Your blade now not only moves faster than the eye can follow, but you have found the trick to following such rapid blows with devastating power.
Strike enemies with Swift Strike or Swift Blade
Swift to Anger
Swift Strike and Swift Blade are dangerous attacks, but require dedication to master them.
This is your objective description.
Complete Mighty Blast
Complete Always in Control
Complete Bountiful Mercy
Class Deeds - Tier 8
Complete these three deeds to earn a Class Trait Point.

'If you have gone to the trouble of getting past enough hide, metal, or mail to make them bleed, you might find it worth your while to cut a strap or two on your way out. I usually do.' -- Brethilthor, Stone-troll Slayer
Rip to Shreds
Use Rend, Brutal Strikes, or Bracing Attack
Your attacks tear through your opponents, leaving none standing.
Your blades now move with such speed as to dismay your foes, and with this speed comes greater power.
Use Blade-wall
All in All
Your Blade Wall has the power to fell many a foe in a single swing.
This is your objective description.

Many a champion improves his running strength barrelling into battles or to the aid of an ally. On occassion, a champion finds all the training useful at the other end of a fight -- but more often its to find the next foe before the last has come to rest on the ground.
Use Sprint
Build your sprinting stamina with focused training.
A true champion knows how and when to draw focus to himself or to divert that focus to others.
Use Ebbing Ire, Battle Frenzy, or Second Wind
At the Ready
Champions are students of battle and become adept at controlling the ebb and flow of each conflict.
This is your objective description.
For champions who have mastered this style of battle, numbers no longer seem important, as their strength grows with each enemy they face.
Use Champion's Challenge
A Challenge Accepted
The Champion is afraid of none and welcomes any foe who accepts their challenge.
This is your objective description.
Your voice has become powerful, able to rattle multiple opponents.
Use Make Haste
A Sense of Urgency
Some things are better when you take your time, decimating your enemies is not one of them.
This is your objective description.
Your anger is rightly feared upon the battlefield, for many foes have fallen before it.
Use Battle-shout
Renewed Voice
A trumpet-call and cry of triumph oft begin the rage of war.
This is your objective description.
Your banner is renowned for its presence at the forefront of battle, leading warriors forth to crush the enemy wherever they might flee or hide.
Summon your Heralds
A Call to Arms
When a Captain calls for aid, they will never be alone.
This is your objective description.
Your foes have come to fear your battle-cry as the harbinger of death and defeat.
Land Critical Hits and Devastates with Devastating Blow
A captain is known for their leadership, but underestimate them in battle and be laid to waste.
This is your objective description.
Your banner has become renowned among the brave, and those who rally to it believe in the strength of your leadership.
Use Shield-brother, Song-brother and Blade-brother
Brother in Arms
A good Captain takes pride, not in individual glory, but rather the shared success of a unit.
This is your objective description.
It is said that a true sign of the Kings of old was the power to heal the sick and injured. Perhaps a trace of their blood runs through your veins?
Land a Critical or Devastate with Valiant Strike or Inspire
Inspire Valour
A Captain is someone to look up to and admire. Their sound technique and valour inspires others to keep fighting.
This is your objective description.
You understand well the role of the archer on the battlefield and the need for precision. Under your training and guidance, your ally has achieved new levels of excellence.
Call forth your archer
Precise Ally
You must field your archer to practice his art in order to cultivate greater skill and precision.
There is greater strength for the courageous than even that which they give to others. It can lead to greater independence, but may also make imparting direct commands impractical.
Crit or Devastate with Sure Strike
Never in Doubt
Before entering battle you must visualize your triumph to ensure the desired outcome.
You have learned the art of aiding your troops by making yourself the centre of the enemy's attention, and your allies will probably live longer for it.
Use Routing Cry
Improved Routing Cry
Fortunately, being the centre of attention in a battle can help lead your allies through safely.
This is your objective description.

It is not possible for each kind word or bold proclamation to have the same effect. The hearts of your companions will receive them each time anew. You have learned how to make the markedly inspiring even more so.
Crit or Devastate with Words of Courage or Rallying Cry
Sometimes courage and motivation just aren't enough, you need to dig deep for that little bit extra.
Your marks encourage those who would stave off the tides of darkness, holding firm where others might break and flee.
Use your Mark skills.
Captain's Victory
Victory is rarely achieved without help. The Captain knows to mark their targets to coordinate their allies.
This is your objective description.
There is an old, old art to summoning the last vestiges of strength from a soldier's worn and injured limbs -- an art that you have now mastered.
Use Rallying Cry
Now for Wrath
All the stalwart bravery in the world will not save a warrior who no longer has the strength to lift their sword.
This is your objective description.
Your martial skills have been well-proven upon the fields of battle, and your foes have come to respect the power of your blade.
Land Critical Hits and Devastates with Devastating Blow
Expert Attacks
A great captain must lead by example. Prove your skill in battle!
This is your objective description.
The blood of Westernesse carries strength to this day, no matter how distant the days of the kings of old may seem.
Strike with Blade of Elendil
Adherent of Elendil
Invoke the name of Elendil, the Elf-friend and king of old, and let his example guide your blade.
True words of courage come from the heart, and they draw upon your strength more greatly than any sword -- but you have mastered them, and they now come easily to you.
Use Muster Courage
Strong Voice
All the florid phrases and knowledge of the hearts of warriors will avail you not if you lack the strength to even draw a breath.
This is your objective description.

The army on the field is one arm as much as it is a thousand. The arm that matters most in the moment is the one holding the blade best positioned to strike. Inspire your brother to deliver the blow, and you all will have swung the tide to victory.
Use the To Arms skill
Tactical Prowess
Master the call to arms and the empowerment of your shield-brother.

The tide of battle is at your command, and it may ebb only if you give it leave to. The commander must yield the advantage, but strike with it and you will strike with ever greater strength and vigour.
Land a Critical Hit or Devastate with Blade of Elendil
In Darkest Days
Even when the situation seems most grim, the Captain is a light that pierces through the darkness and inspires hope in the hopeless.
A sound defence is often more important than an explosive offence.
Parry enemy attacks
Quick Wrist
A sound defence is often more important than an explosive offence.
A sound defence is often more important than an explosive offence.
Even when the need is great or desperate, if the commander upon the field is composed, a personal sacrifice may yet yield a greater gift of inspiration and hope.
Use the Grave Wound skill
Grave Digger
You aim to inflict a grave wound that your enemy will never fully recover from.
Action is the best spark to kindle fire in your shield-brother's heart.
Use the Inspire skill
Deeds Before Words
Be an example to your shield-brother, and you will find your inspiration greater still.
There are words you have learned, mundane words filled with a truth that works magic in the hearts of free wills.
Use Words of Courage
Fear No Darkness
Warriors must have courage to do battle, and in battle it is your sworn duty to ensure they have it.
This is your objective description.
Your skill with the blade allows you to greatly protect yourself.
Use Sure Strike
With Absolute Certainty
Sometimes you can't afford mistakes.
This is your objective description.
You have grown skilled at discovering and exploiting the weaknesses of your enemies.
Use Reveal Weakness
Every creature has its weak spots -- eyes, throat, spleen, something -- you just need to figure out what they are.
This is your objective description.
It has long been known that the forces of Evil suffer from impatience and ill-tempers, and you have learned the knack of using that to your own advantage.
Use Provoke or Trick Removal skills
No Time For Games
You must exercise patience and self control in battle, and always make efforts to ensure your opponent does not do the same.
This is your objective description.
It is neither fair nor particularly honourable, but striking from the shadows is safer than hurling yourself into the mouth of some fire-breathing monster.
Use your special Stealth attacks
Hidden Dagger
It is always surprising how many enemies forget to look over their shoulder during a fight.
Strike your enemies from the shadows.
Escaping from the middle of a fray requires more than just subtlety -- it requires subtlety and a quick pair of feet.
Use your Sneak skill
Moving silently is easy -- moving silently and quickly? That is a challenge....
Sometimes even the most innocuous wound will bleed profusely. You have learned how best to bleed your foe.
Strike with Cunning Attack
Cunning Wound
Burglars cannot rely on strength and power to defeat their enemies -- but a severely bleeding wound will often do the trick.
Cunning Wound
Pain is a good teacher, and there is no armour as effective as not being beneath an enemy's blade when it falls.
Evade enemy attacks
When Orcs are raining arrows down upon you, you had best have a spring in your step.
This is your objective description.
Burglars work best when taking advantage of confused and overwhelmed opponents. Once allies have an enemy trapped, then your skills come fully into play.
Use Critical Hit chain finishing skills
Finish What You Started
An explosive start can be ruined if you do not follow through. Make sure you finish what you started.
This is your objective description.
It is all about the dust. Some burglars will just use whatever is lying around, but you know better...the finer the grains, the bigger the cloud.
Use Tricks
So what if it is an old trick? The old tricks are the best tricks.
This is your objective description.
A steady hand can Burgle great riches from unwitting targets.
Burgle your foes
Take what you want and never apologize.
Precision and patience yield perfection and, for your foe, new depths of pain.
Use Critical Hit Chain opening skills
Better and Better
With each blow you improve and become more dangerous to your foes.
The best riddle is one whose answer is obvious the moment after it is revealed. The strongest puzzles are the ones tempered through trial and proven with practice.
Use your Riddle or Trick Removal skills
Resistance is Futile
No matter how hard your opponents fight back, your resolve will always win out in the end.
You are skilled at taking advantage of weaknesses in your enemy's defences, allowing you to make telling blows with but a simple stab.
Strike using Subtle Stab
Swift and Subtle
With extensive practice, your Subtle Stab will improve in deadliness.
Strike enemies using the Subtle Stab skill.
Riddles have been an honoured challenge in Middle-earth since time before memory. Even hardened warriors may find themselves caught up in the game.
Pose Riddles to your enemies
Perplexing Riddle
A clever burglar can confuse opponents with odd challenges and riddles.
This is your objective description.
When facing off against the gambling Burglar, the odds are that their enemies find cruel chance at the point of a blade.
Achieve a critical hit with any skill unlocked by a critical hit
Cruel Odds
To better twist chance in your favour, you must first master the art of piling victory on top of success.
When attacking from surprise, it is easier to find gaps in an enemy's armour and make your blow count.
Land Critical blows with skills that benefit from stealth
Strike from Shadows
You have only one shot when ambushing an opponent -- make it count!
Strike from Shadows
You are capable of landing precise blows quickly, bringing to an end in short order what might have been a long battle.
Use skills which apply bleeds
Bleeding is Better
There is much to be learned from seeing a foe's reaction to an open wound, and you consider yourself a scholar.
This is your objective description.
One of the most important tricks to moving stealthily is learning to move when your enemy's eyes are elsewhere.
Use your Diversion skill successfully
If you cannot be seen, you cannot be killed. So do not be seen.
Distract your enemies and improve your ability to remain unseen as you move about.
Some creatures are too dangerous to be allowed to fight unimpeded. By interfering with their weapons, or forcing them off-balance, you can slow them down.
Use Addle against an enemy
Mass Confusion
An opponent who cannot think clearly is vulnerable.
This is your objective description.
Pain is a good teacher, and there is no armour as effective as not being beneath an enemy's blade when it falls.
Parry enemy attacks
Quick Wrist
The best remedy for an explosive offence is a sound defence.
You have learned that the momentum of success may sometimes lead forwards and sometimes backwards. When you have the edge, taking a gamble is not such a gamble as it might have been before.
Use the Touch and Go skill
On the Move
Make the most of successful coordination with your allies, be it to strike fast or ready an escape.
Now your foes will know -- however briefly -- that location truly is everything, and that this particular location is somewhere behind their back.
An Unpleasant Surprise
Use the Surprise Strike skill
Those who strike first often see more success, and you like your odds.
If they thought your riddle perplexing, just wait until they hear this....
Crit with a Critical Hit chain skill
Insult to Injury
As a burglar, you know that you must take advantage of any opportunity that presents itself and revel in the moments when luck is on your side.
Your enemies believe that your shield is simply an obstacle to be circumvented, and so go to their defeat believing, never understanding whence came the blow that felled them.
Strike enemies with Shield-blow
Shield Expertise
To truly measure the worth of a shield, one must master it as a living thing with a motion and cunning equal to that of any sword or bow.
This is your objective description.
Some fools would believe that a solid defence means sitting around like some kind of rock. If only it were that easy or restful, but you know better.
Strike enemies with Guardian's Ward
Guardian's Ward
Constant vigilance is needed to protect oneself in battle. A moment's forgetfulness can be the end of you.
This is your objective description.

The unexpected shock of a blow against a sturdy shield can injure the attacker more than the defender. All you need to do is add a little power to your blocks, and your foes will feel it more than you do.
Strike enemies with Shield-swipe
Reactive Block
A shield is not simply some hobbit's door that has been strapped to your arm. It is as effective a weapon as any, and better than most for one who has mastered it.
This is your objective description.
Your simple, stinging blow yields greater damage against your foes.
Strike enemies with the Sting skill
Stinging Blow
Sometimes the most basic styles avail the greatest results.
This is your objective description.
It is important to time your breathing with the rise and fall of your blows as you hew through your enemies.
Use Catch a Breath
Controlled Breathing
There is no point in going into a fight if you always run out of breath just as things are getting good.
This is your objective description.
As you have continued to practice your Sting skill, your attacks have become noticeably faster.
Strike enemies with the Sting skill
Time is of the essence in battle. It can either be your ally or your enemy. It is best to have it on your side, because you are not going to beat it in the end.
This is your objective description.

'Nowadays, when someone asks for credit, I just give them \qThe Look'\q...you know? Sure, I learned it on the field, but it still comes in handy at the shop.' -- Patrick Pot-patcher, Guardian, retired
Strike with Bash
Never Bashful
Guardians don't always stand out, but if underestimated, they've been known to get violent.
You can no longer be found wanting, for your bravery is matched by only a few, and they too are great warriors.
Use Warrior's Heart
Brave Heart
Every warrior tests his limits and faces his own mortality in battle.
This is your objective description.
A quick boot, swiftly applied, can disrupt many an enemy's plans -- and it is best that the plans of the enemy do not come to fruition.
Strike with Stamp
Quick of Foot
Practice your stamp to interrupt your foes, for using the skill repeatedly will help you to perform it with greater ease in the future.
'Without balance, movement is hampered; without movement, speed is hindered; without speed, the fight is against you. Remember this and apply it to your foe.' -- Tirnedhruith, Guardian Trainer
Strike with Stagger
Hit Where It Hurts
A well-placed strike can throw your opponent off-balance.
Few things sharpen the wit or quicken the feet so effectively as a rain of arrows and blades.
Evade enemy attacks
To the Rescue
Above all, a Guardian must be where they are needed and quickly, for your companions are not so sturdy as you.
This is your objective description.
Meaning within meaning and allusions away from the truth can work to a rune-keeper's advantage.
Use any Words of Grace skills
Master of Allusion
Your ability to write between the lines confounds your foes.
Wrath, like fire, may burn bright but cold...or hot and nigh invisible. With your rage channelled, you control the venting of your anger and stoke the fires as you wish.
Strike with Wrath of Flame skills
Tale of Rage
Learn to let your temper loose in your writing, and it shall burn through to your foes.
Greatness can be seen in the details; great details can be seen in the world.
Use Fury of Storm skills
Your narratives combine the chill of a winter night and the turbulence of the fiercest storm.
Runes may bind the stone upon which they are written, preserving meaning and integrity.
Use any rune-stone
Rune Master
You rely on your rune-stone in battle, and together, you cannot fail.
Few are prepared the first time they experience even the simplest of your runes.
Strike with Scribe's Spark
Thunderous Words
The spark may light the way to greater things.
Kindly do words come to those who need them and linger with care.
Use Mending Verse, Sustaining Bolt, or Smouldering Wrath
Your enemies would be wise to not judge a book by its cover and to not underestimate a Rune-keeper.
Insults, as burns, may fade slowly from memory and leave scars longer still.
Use any Writ
Written in Stone
Through fire, ice, and sustainability, you can fell any foe.
You have learned to leave your foes with a memory of biting cold that can linger long in their mind...and their feet.
Use Ceaseless Argument, Epic for the Ages, Essay of Fire
Epic Essay
Like all the great tales, your battles end in an epic conclusion.
Grave portents may give the uncertain pause, but with practiced eye, foresight may come more swiftly to sight.
Use the skills \qDo Not Fall This Day\q and \qScribe a New Ending\q
The Prophetic Word
Practice the art of casting your vision forwards, and you shall be able to do it with greater frequency.
When you know your purpose, you can craft your words with intent to be effective and yet cunningly subtle.
Use Distracting Flame
Stare at the Flame
There are few things as simple and beautiful as fire, and the Rune-keeper knows how to use its majesty to their advantage.
'If you cannot endure the heat, stay of the library' -- Ciryalen, Rune-keeper in the north
Strike with Fiery Ridicule
Conflagration of Runes
With practice, you can kindle flame from fragments faster and with less effort.
'I find that necessity is an excellent motivator.' -- Gronir, dwarf stone-keeper
Use Self-motivation
Self Starter
You draw strength from within and find motivation that will carry you further than before.

The cold bites and the fire burns, but why would not tongues of flame also bear teeth? Fire and frost are not so different in their harsher aspects--though inimical to one another, they may be doubly so to those afflicted by them.
Critically hit with any Writ
A Critical Writ
Writs are always effective, sometimes more than others.
Unending discourse is your art, but it can sometimes take your foes by surprise. Of course, such is your aim.
Use Ceaseless Argument, Epic for the Ages, Essence of Flame
Harsh Words
Learn how to unsettle your foe with your unrelenting assertions.
If only your foes would learn to fear your reach, they might realize there is no place where they are safe when assailing you.
Strike with Shocking Touch
Confounding Principles
Improve the effect your touch can have upon your foe.
If your foe does not understand you, it may be that the connotation of your words was too confusing.
Use Combustion, Concession and Rebuttal, or Bombastic Inspiration
Few dare to engage you in a war of words, and those who do, lose.
Welcome words can be given to those in need with less notice taken by those who would not see them sent.
New Beginnings
Use Nothing Truly Ends
When one door closes, another opens.
Fire weakens as it burns, reducing your foe's protections against fire.
Use any Rune-Sign of X
Sign of the Times
All signs point to a grisly end for your foes.
As the runes may protect against ignorance, so may they also defend against the blade.
Use Armour of the Elements
Armour of Exaltation
Protecting oneself in battle is paramount when dealing with the monsters of Middle-earth.
The crash of thunder carries finality, and the silence that follows is broken only by receding echoes unto the horizon.
Use Final Word
Closing Remarks
Having the final word does not guarantee a positive outcome, but it certainly helps.
Tragedy in literature can tug at the heartstrings...tragedy in the world can tug down fortified walls.
Critical Hits with Fury of the Storm skills
Master of Tragedy
Your studies in the construction of tragedy can have tremendous impact upon your foes.
An epic is sometimes best presented in a shorter form.
Use Scribe a New Ending
Alternate Ending
The ending of this tale is yours to determine.

Find the History of the Dúnedain
Find the Flowers of the Old Forest
For many generations the Dúnedain of Cardolan buried their dead within the Downs, until the Great Plague destroyed the last vestiges of Cardolan, and spirits from Angmar claimed the barrows.
For years beyond memory it has been a forbidding place, which Men and hobbits alike have shunned. Hobbit-tales tell that the trees are aware and can move of their own accord.
Find pages of the Journal of Cardolan lost within the Barrow Downs.

Even in the blasted wastes of Angmar, there remain a few small bastions of resistance and valour to strive against the darkness.

The ancient fortress of the Witch-king of Angmar is rumoured to be surrounded by eight dread towers within which his lieutenants resided during the long war with Arnor, weaving their dread magic there against the forces of the West.

There is a great road that leads through the wastes of Angmar to the very gates of Carn Dûm. It is along this road that the dark armies march forth to bring the Free Peoples of Eriador under the yoke of the Enemy.
Seven swords have been stolen from Krúslë Lannan and must be returned to their proper resting place.

Once the capital of the North, Evendim has nonetheless always had its wild places and mysteries -- and those have grown stranger and more dangerous still in the long years since Annúminas was abandoned.
Far across the waters of lake Evendim lie lands long unexplored by Men.

The kings of Annúminas were intered within tombs along the road to the gate of the city.
Nine were the kings that ruled over Arnor from this ancient seat of power, but not all of them were buried in the Way of Kings...

Garth Agarwen lies in the north-east hills of the Lone-lands. Once a great fortress of the ancient kingdoms, rumours say that it has become a stronghold of corruption and evil.
The Grimfens are in the south-east extent of the Lone-lands. Travellers have avoided this place for as long as any can remember -- and for good reason.
Weathertop is in the western half of the Lone-lands. Its proper name of old is Amon Sûl, and within it once lay one of the palantíri of the ancient kingdoms.
Explore Garth Agarwen
Explore the Grimfens

Explore Weathertop
Explorer of the Lone-lands
Explore the ruins of forts and towers that once guarded the roads, the ancient ruin of Amon Sûl or more commonly known as Weathertop, and the stronghold of corruption and evil that is Garth Agarwen.
The Lone-lands were once host to a string of forts and towers that guarded the roads against the incursions of Angmar and Rhudaur. Long ago, they fell into ruin with the defeat of the North Kingdom.
Explore Where Giants Dwell
Find Bilbo's Buttons

While most folks sensibly stay home and tend to fields and shops, some hardy adventurers are drawn to the most inhospitable and difficult places in Middle-earth. Few such places pose so great a challenge as the stretch of the Misty Mountains surrounding the region of the High Pass, which is fraught with hazards -- both natural and otherwise -- to test the most rugged individuals.

Few know the full extent of the depths of Goblin-town, and those who have experienced them most likely died therin as slaves to cruel goblin-overseers. The goblins themselves may not know all the ways, for the deepest passages extend far into the heart of the Misty Mountains where dark and unseen terrors lie, and the goblins will not brave these passages unless driven or enraged.

There are not many ruins to be found in the Misty Mountains, for few indeed are those willing to build anything of note in such an inhospitable environment. Those that are to be found here were built long ago by the dwarves.
Explore the Forbidding Heights
Explore Goblin-town
Explore the High Passes
Explore the Ruins of the Misty Mountains
Explorer of the Misty Mountains

Explore the mountain passes of the Misty Mountains with ruins built long ago by the dwarves. However the way is treacherous, often choked with snow, knife-like winds, and other more aggressive hazards.

Travellers have long told tales of the mighty and capricious giants that inhabit the cold peaks of the Misty Mountains, you must seek out their places for yourself however, for there are few who have seen them left to tell you the way.

In order to cross the Misty Mountains, travellers have long had to traverse high and trecherous passes, often choked with snow, knife-like winds, and other more aggressive hazards. Seek out these passes and learn the secret ways of the mountains.

How strange...scattered throughout the warrens of Goblin-town seem to be a set of old, well-worn brass buttons, as if lost from a Hobbit's waistcoat. How in the world did such things come to be in these dark and twisted tunnels?
An odd people calling themselves the Earth-kin have been discovered in the eastern North Downs. Seek out their villages and learn more of them, and whether they be friend or foe.
Many ruins lie forgotten in lands east of the Baranduin. Explore them and determine if they have fallen into the hands of the Enemy.
Explore the ruins scattered in and around the Fields of Fornost
Explore the Villages of the Earth-kin
Explore the Eastern Ruins

Explore the Fields of Fornost, the villages of the Earth-kin, and the many ruins that lie forgotten in lands of the North Downs.
Spy out the Orc and goblin-strongholds in the North Downs.
Farming represents the heart of the Shire, and farmsteads can be found throughout -- the largest of which surround the town of Michel Delving.
The pastoral peace of the Shire presents travellers with an excellent opportunity to explore its historical and cultural places.
Explore the Farms of the Shire
Explore the Sights of the Shire
Explorer of the Shire
Explore the historical and cultural places as well as the farmsteads that can be found throughout the Shire.

The lone winding road through the Trollshaws leads to the last bastion of civilization for a great many leagues. Travellers must take great care while exploring this road however, for it is not well-guarded from the dangers of the wild.

These lands once were the eastern extent of the old kingdom of Rhudaur. They have lain in ruins for many long years now and most are inhabited only by wild beasts -- or horrid creatures that have crawled more recently out of the depths of Angmar.
Explore the Road to Rivendell
Explore the Ruins of the Trollshaws
Explore the Wilds of Tâl Bruinen
Explorer of the Trollshaws
Explore the lone winding road through the Trollshaws, but be wary as it is not well-guarded from the dangers of the wild.

The southern Trollshaws are dominated by the Wilds of Tâl Bruinen. Few even amongst the Elves live here now, and the forested hills have become heavily overgrown and inhabited mostly by wild beasts that pose a constant danger to travellers and the few who try to eke out an existence in these undisciplined lands.

Complete 'Book 9: The Ring of Power'

You have crossed the White Mountains and come into Gondor, where new adventures await. The servants of Sauron assail this last bastion of the Free Peoples, and the Dark Lord turns his greatest strength upon the south-kingdom.
Complete 'Book 1: The Road to Gondor'
The Strength of Sauron
Unravel the Epic Story for Volume IV: The Strength of Sauron.
With the aid of the Woses you found the Riders of Rohan and joined their charge to the fields of Pelennor. The battle is joined, and the fate of Gondor hangs in the balance.

The armies of Gondor and Mordor clashed on the fields of the Pelennor, and you stood with your friends against the ravening Morgul hordes. The cost of victory was high. Many heroes will not return to their homes to see the peace their lives have bought.
You crossed through the expanse of Central Gondor and came to the port city of Pelargir, where you faced Balakhôr the Scourge and ended the threat of Umbar.

Following the defeat of the Corsairs at Pelargir, Aragorn entrusted you with the mission of keeping secret his capture of their ships and his plan to sail up the Anduin to the aid of Minas Tirith. You went by another road to Osgiliath, now held by the enemy, and sabotaged the great war machine Grond. It was there that you encountered a foe you thought had been dispatched: Mordirith, once the Steward of Angmar, eternal slave of the Witch-king. He had been wrested from the Void and sent back in a new guise, and as the wraith Gothmog he commands many of the forces of Mordor.

You arrived at the great city of Minas Tirith with little time to spare, as the forces of the Enemy encircle the White City and prepare to mount their siege. From a secret chamber in the Tower of Ecthelion, Steward Denethor wrestled against the despair of Sauron in the depths of the Anor-stone. If no allies come, and soon, the doom of which he speaks must surely fall upon Minas Tirith.

Aragorn has undertaken a dangerous mission: he marches to the Black Gate of Mordor with an army too small to wage serious war against the forces of Sauron. And yet, the Host of the West occupies every thought of the Dark Lord, for he is consumed with fear that Aragorn has obtained the Ring of Power and seeks to install himself as sovereign.

Aragorn's dangerous scheme to draw the eye of the Dark Lord has borne fruit, but it brings an upsetting revelation: Sauron has captured a hobbit within Mordor, and his dark messenger displays tokens of proof: Bilbo's mail-shirt, Sam's short sword, and an Elf-cloak of Lórien. The Quest of the Ring has failed. The Host of the West fights on, but the circle in which it stands draws ever smaller as the end approaches...

And so it was that the Quest of the Ring came to a successful conclusion, and Sauron was destroyed. In the end, it was not through feat of strength or prowess in combat that the Dark Lord was undone, but by the courage and fortitude of two hobbits, and the mercy they showed to another: Sméagol of the river-folk. He it was who destroyed the Ring and ended the dominion of Sauron.

Bilbo Baggins is in Rivendell, and will be most interested that you found a copy of his book.
On this page, Bilbo describes Gandalf's declaration to the dwarves that he will soon be leaving them on their own in order to see to his own affairs.

On this page, Bilbo describes Gandalf's plan for introducing the dwarves to Beorn: two by two, very carefully, very slowly, and very politely. This account of Beorn makes him sound very quick to anger.

On this page, Bilbo describes the arrival at Beorn's house, and particularly the tremendously large bees that live there even today. Beorn took great pride in his bee-pastures, and so too does his son Grimbeorn.

On this page, Bilbo describes his first meeting with Beorn. Your relative's tremendous size and bluster made an impression on the hobbit, as did his reluctance to entertain any guests. Fortunately the party consisted only of Bilbo and Gandalf... as far as Beorn knew.

On this page, Bilbo describes how Gandalf introduced the remaining dwarves at such a slow pace as to keep Beorn's curiosity piqued but not so quick as to anger him. You have heard variations of this story from Grimbeorn quite often during your childhood.
On this page, Bilbo describes the delicious meal that Beorn served after all the dwarves had arrived, and the stories that your relative told of Mirkwood and the mountains.
Talk to Bilbo Baggins at the Last Homely House in Rivendell.

The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.
A Hobbit's Holiday was written by Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit from the Shire who went on an unexpected and surprising adventure. You leaf through the pages with interest to read his account of meeting your ancestor Beorn, but you are unable to find it.
Many of the pages in the middle of the book have gone missing. An entire chapter seems to be missing. Is it the chapter where he met Beorn?

On this page, Bilbo describes an uneasy sleep punctuated with growling outside his door and the sound of many animals. The fear he felt would not have been eased had he known the true extent of Beorn's nature, but you know that he was never in any danger from your fierce relative.
You should search for missing pages from A Hobbit's Holiday throughout Angmar and the Misty Mountains.
This page contains the final section of the genealogical charts, which has brought the line of Beorn down to your generation: you, Sterkist, and Langhár.

This page contains a number of paragraphs concerning Grimbeorn, the son of Beorn and your relative. He is the leader and patriarch of your folk, and maintains the lodge where Beorn once lived. He is now very old, and has little patience for the fancies of the young.

This page contains several paragraphs of information about your cousin Varthmath and his siblings. Most of them range further afield and do not stay near the lodge, so you do not know them as well as Varthmath.
This page briefly describes the heritage of your sister Langhár, but most of the page is blank. You suppose that it is waiting to be filled with her deeds.

You have found a book that purports to trace the genealogy of your family. Perhaps Bilbo Baggins, currently staying in Rivendell, will know something about it.

This page contains some paragraphs of information about Beorn, your relative and the apparent forebear of your line. Even you have little information about Beorn's parentage, and if Grimbeorn knew of it he never spoke of it to you.
This page contains a paragraph of information about Ofolmóth, your one-time relative. The information is now... outdated.

This page briefly describes the heritage of your brother Sterkist, but most of the page is blank. You suppose that it is waiting to be filled with his deeds. Curiously, his name is misspelled. You decide to spare his feelings and not tell him about the error.
This page is about you! It is mostly blank. You suppose it is waiting to be filled with record of your deeds. One day you should write your own page in this book.
Talk to Bilbo Baggins at the Last Homely House in Rivendell.
